Pastylki do zmywarki są beznajdziejne. Data na opakowaniu wskazuje że powinny być ok, ale tak nie jest. Są jakieś zwietrzałe, po otwarciu wyglądają na chropowate i się obsypują i prawie w każdej czerwony element odpada(jest luźny). Każde uruchomienie kończyło się niedomytymi naczyniami.Już myślałem, że coś ze zmywarką ale na szczęście nie. Ewidentnie ta partia pastylek. Kupiłem inne i jest wszystko jak być powinno. Nie wiem co o tym myśleć.

Używam tych kapsułek od lat; wyłącznie tych. Próbowałem kilku innych rodzajów, ale się nie sprawdzały. Te — Finish Quantum Ultimate — być może mogłyby być jeszcze bardziej idealne, gdyby z ich powodu nie znikały niektóre nadruki/wzorki na ceramice i szkle. Ale coś za coś. Czyszczą doskonale. Ta konkretna paczka 50 sztuk ma tę dodatkową zaletę, że jest w wygodnym pojemniku do przechowywania. Pojemnik robi wrażenie odrobinę nieszczelnego, więc dopiero się przekonam, czy w trakcie przechowywania kapsułki nie zawilgotnieją i się nie posklejają.

Jeśli ktoś myje same garnki to polecam, jeśli porcelanę to zdecydowanie odradzam.

Kupiłem już drugi raz te tabletki. I dają radę. Zawsze wszystko domywało, było jedynie parę przypadków niedomycia szklanki/kubka. Lepsze od Finisha używanego wcześniej.
To już kolejny zakup tego produktu. Świetna jakość. Polecam !

Tabletki Somat Nie domywają naczyń.Nie rozpuszczaja się calkowicie. Próbowalam w 3 różnych programach i za każdym razem wyciągałam brudne naczynia. Zaznaczam,że zmywarka jest nowa i sprawna.Sól też dosypana.

Ja jestem średnio zadowolona z tych tabletek. Już kilka razy mi się nie rozpuściła w zmywarce, resztki pozostawały na naczyniach. Dobrze za to poradziła sobie pozostawiona na całą noc jako środek do wyczyszczenia spalonego garnka. Jeszcze trochę mi zostało tych tabletek więc daje im szansę.

Wg mnie nie są to dobre tabletki. Naczynia są matowe po nich i jakby niedomyte, w zmywarce po nich nieświeży zapach.
miały być takie super pierwsse pranie garów i lipa. wszystko brudne tableta nie rozpuszczona.

Tabletki bardzo dobrze zmywają, aczkolwiek zawartość soli w tych tabletkach jest na tyle niska, że bez stosowania soli oddzielnie w zmywarce pojawił się biały osad, a naczynia miały dziwny zapach. Stosowanie soli usunęło problem. Nie zmienia to jednak faktu, że jestem zadowolony z poziomu czystości naczyń. Usuwają trudny do usunięcia osad z herbaty.

tabletki zostawiają taki jakby osad na szkle. używałem wcześniej innych tabletek i nie było problemu.
Tabletki zmywają jak należy. Łatwe w użyciu. Dobra cena. Polecam!
Bardzo dobry produkt dobrze zmywa wszelkie zabrudzenia.

Używam od 8 miesięcy tych tabletek. Sprawują się bardzo dobrze.

Używam od kilku lat i są bezkonkurencyjne w porównaniu z innymi tabletkami. Bardzo dobrze działają - naczynia zawsze lśnią. Pojedyncze przypadki, mimo że tabletka nie rozpuściła się do końca, to i tak naczynia umyte bardzo dobrze.
Tabletki somat gold polecam koszt jednej sztuki bardzo niski
Świetnie myją dla mnie dużo lepsze od finish
Sehr guter Reiniger reinigt ohne meckern mein Geschirr, nur weshalb ich nur 2 Sterne gebe ist dieser wiederliche Geruch den ich nicht aus meiner Nase bekomme wenn ich die Dose auf mache !!

I've been using these for years, first at home, then in my shop's kitchen, and now at home again. They're the best Finish tablet out there, and if you're sticking on a full load at 65°C+ they are exactly what you need to get the job done.. So why only four stars? For five days out of seven, there are only two of us in the house. We don't create much mess to put in the dishwasher, and I'd like to be able to use the short cycle, which should be adequate for our needs, as well as cheaper and more environmentally friendly. But with these I can't, because they don't dissolve adequately and I then find a lump of goo in the bottom of the dishwasher.. Granted, Finish don't claim that they're great for short washes. But they've had time to sort that out since they first brought these to market. And in the meantime, the guys on the Fairy stand at the Booker Show last year said their Platinum capsules are designed to handle the shorter washes AS WELL.. So there we go. My next dishwasher capsules will be Fairy. We'll see how those match up then.

Dishwasher tablets are subjective and everyone's opinions of what gives good results are their own.. Mine is that these are the premium standard.. Value is in the eye of the beholder but I've not failed to have a fantastic wash out of these whereas some supermarket brands can be hit and miss, though they have recently upped their game and move to a similar style tablet.. A lot equally depends on the cycle chosen and whilst good results can be had at low temps, doing so is bad for the machine. The machine needs higher temps to fully breakdown and clean all the material not just form the plates but int he pipes and everywhere else etc.. But, in conclusion these tablets are superb. Up to you to decide if they represent appropriate value in your own circumstance though.

The leading brand for a reason. Keep going back to finish tablets after being disappointed by Fairy and Ecover tabs. Can't go wrong if these are on offer although I realised to get the best from them you still need to use rinse aid and salt. Especially in a hard water area like London.

One of the best dishwasher tablets on the market in my opinion I have tries other brands but keep coming back to this one.. This washes dishes really well, nice and clean with a great shine on all glassware. Most of the time cheaper tablets tend to make glass dull and opaque but this one doesn't do that. I have had drinking glasses stay shiny for years with this brand of tablets however, no matter how good a dishwasher tablet it still erases the pattern from outside the glass.. For most daily loads these manage the dirtiest of dishes but still dried on food is still a challenge but this brand does way better than most with a little in the corners just left over occasionally. . Saucepans also dull over time but this happens quicker with other makes, I wash mine by hand anyway.. It copes with high and low temperatures as the coloured section is gel. The tablets come without a covering so less fiddly.. I still have a few things I dont trust in the dishwasher whatever the powder or tablet used as the washing process is far to long for some items. Most dishwashers have a delicate programme including mine but I still wash up real delicate items and plastic by hand.
Never eaten them in my life and would not recommend anyone eat them ever! Used them for years in my dishwasher.

I used these tablets on my old cutlery and it came out like new. Even the scratches had disappeared, so I theorised that the quantum effect had in fact created a wormhole in my dishwasher through which the original cutlery was able to return. To test my theory, I put the rest of the pack in the dishwasher, hoping to receive a full pack again at the end of the cycle and an infinite supply of dishwasher tablets that I planned to sell cheaply on e-bay. Unfortunately all that came out was a load of foam and a large, soggy, unidentifiable glutenous mass that could either be the remains of the pack or a life form from another dimension. My wife was furious but the kitchen floor came up sparkling.

We have used these dishwasher "tablets" for years. They work as good as any of the other brands and better than most, are competitively priced (especially when buying five items on the subscribe and save - £8.50 for 64 as at 18th October 2019) and work well in our dishwasher.. They come well packaged and separate well when required for use providing that you keep them in a cool, dry place. In use, they dissolve fully 95% of the time (not sure why sometimes bits get left behind) and provide a good detergent to clean our crockery etc well.. Well worth 5 stars

These tablets do something special. All I do I place it in a compartment, it vanishes over time and the plates get clean. I think its either witchcraft or it works so hard cleaning the dirt off the plates until it doesn't exist anymore

I had previously ordered some Classic wash tablets - but they proved inadequate. In fact I thought my dishwasher was defective until Amazon sent me two Quantum Max tablets as a trial. and what an experience. They were so much better than the Classic and I didn't have a problem with the dishwasher after all; all my crockery shiny and sparkling.. I immediately ordered this pack of 60 Quantum Max and was of course delighted with the speed of delivery and the quality of the wash.. Gramps
I've had a subscription for these for years now. They work great and I can't see a reason not to recommend them.

Never Been Cleaner.. other tablets leave an unseen residue on the dishes.. if you lick a plate after certain tablets have been used, you can taste the unseen residue on the finished dishes.. with these tablets there is absolutely no taste of residue and they are sparkling.. i will never buy a different tablet ever again.
I always buy finish for my dishwasher. I have tried many other products, but these give me the best results.
Great for cleaning dishes, taste horrible hence the poor score in that area!
This product worked beautifully when I first bought it but it now leaves marks. It's either the dishwasher (a Miele) or the machine.

Product arrived super quick and are doing me proud. THE ONLY PROBLEM IS the developers at Finish (the diamond standard) have taken away x2 of the x14 quantum promises on the back of the pack. I've lost the guarantee of spot-free glasses, I've lost the guarantee of the powder and gel working in unison to create a better clean, but most worryingly, I've lost my ability to go to sleep at night without thinking about my crockery and whether or not I've placed it in the right hands. Other than that really happy with the product and service. Photo 1 product comparison. Photo 2 New product (x12). Photo 3 Old product (x14)

I used the cheaper version power plus I think they were called and I was not at all happy with the results. I have been using these tablets for six months or more now and they really do work very well I won't be changing from these in a hurry

I like this product if used with another Finish tablet, the Powerball Max at the same time thus doubling up on cost. You can see the picture of my stainless steel pan gleaming when useing one of each of PB and Quantum. The results of Quantum on its own in my Siemens top of the range dishwasher were dismal. I was left with coffee rings on mugs, dull stainless steel and very poor cleaning on plastic implements. So in my opinion they are not suitable for my type of Siemen Dishwasher as they did not clean well on there own.. Hopefully other makes of machine give outstanding performance. I was refunded because the discription did not match the advertised performance. I will not be purchasing again.
If this item was something I would not use, I would cancel my order, so up to now it is doing everything I expect from a washing sachet. Regards Ron

Perfect, even the most soiled pans and casserole dishes come clean on one wash. I must admit I always use the intensive program irrespective of what I am washing but that way everything is always cleaned first time and I don't have to do a re-wash. I have tried cheaper tablets including the ones from Finish and Fairy but Quantum is easily the best performing of all of these. Even though I wash on intensive my glassware is the best - no white streaks you can't remove - no scratches or dullness - no petrol type colours - just crystal clear glass. I even put in my non-stick. Five stars.

It's the only cleaner I've found that removes all the stains from my mugs - I drink black coffee and mostly tea without milk which does leave a mess in the mug, but this tablet leaves them really white again. Also, my teaspoons are shiny again as they were when I bought them. As I said, not the cheapest but as far as I'm concerned, the best and worth the expense.

These are the only dishwasher tablets that do the job thoroughly! Glasses are nice and shiny, cutlery is brilliantly shiny - even when the machine is put on a quick wash (30 mins), and the load is dry when the cycle is finished. However, I generally use on a one and a half hour cycle for times after big meals.. They are the most expensive tabs but they get the job done and nothing else is needed: no salt, no extra rinse aid - just the tablets! Thoroughly recommended!

I stopped using Finish tablets as I found they didn't give a clean sparkle. I bought these on offer and I'm pleased that the Quantum Max tabs give far better results than other tabs in the Finish range.. I tried these with a wash which included a cermamic dish with some oven cooked sauce stuck to it, along with a greasy roasting dish. Both washed clean, first time and look better than they did pre wash. The smell post wash from the machine isn't overpowering and I'll be happy to buy the max tabs again.
I’ve always bought these and I’ll continue to. They always work really well and get everything clean
a bit expensive, but in lieu of a supermarket delivery acceptable price
I always have used finish products for the last 30 years..but find just now and then with this gel cover they stick and do not dissolve

Very poor product, super disappointed. I cannot tell if it is this supplier or the actual product. It seems either the product was old or fake. They just melt and get stuck to the tablet dispenser an/or leaving dredges on the door etc, I have never had that happen with normal Finish Powerball product (purple packaging). I have used the normal straight after worked like a dream. Also this product tables broke some of them, so there was crumbs of the blue powder from the broken tablets. Very unpleasant to be honest. I would stay away from this product. I was hoping to use less chemicals solution as that is what the packet professes, but honestly, if it doesn't work, whats the point. I do not want to risk spending another chunk of money and try this product from another supplier, but then one i got from is useless.

I had trouble with these tablets not dissolving properly when I put them in the cleaning liquid container, so I ended up putting these in the cutlery container and running it on an ECO 50 degree wash.

I find that with any of these tablets for a good result one must rinse soiled items off especially if the machine is being left at that point until full as any delay in washing allows for all items not rinsed to dry which then makes more difficult for the machine to do its job particully if the machine is an older one

Finish Quantum are meant to be the best you can get for dishwashing. I say meant to be because they don't always clean dishes properly.. I have found that if I have had a cup of hot chocolate or something with a tomato and meat sauce like a Bolognese, it struggles getting the item cleaned. It leaves part of the sauce on the cutlery/plates. I do try and rinse the dishes before they go in the dishwasher, but my dishwasher also has a pre-rinse function built into the wash cycle. I didn't do the traditional scrambled egg method either, a good dishwasher tablet should be able to clean the scrambled egg pan!. I do like the no need to unwrap idea, but lets face it, unwrapping a dishwasher tablet doesn't really take that much effort, and with these tablets you have to keep them in a dry place otherwise you end up with mush.. I have also found that I still need to add rinse aid to my machine. I live in a medium water area but always ended up with white spots all over my pans and glasses, adding in the rinse aid has done away with that now.. I had always used Fairy Platinum in the past as they had the capability of cleaning the dishwasher as well as the stuff it was washing. You would think for the price that the Finish tablets would also do that but they don't. They only have a limescale protection and filter protection.. So for the money, I wouldn't say they were the greatest.

I prefer to use the Quantum Max tablets as opposed to cheaper alternatives, as these have everything combined - saves having to buy dishwasher salt and other bits (too much hassle!). They're also recommended by my dishwasher manufacturer, AEG.. Cleans everything perfect each and every time - even on the 30min quick wash.. I now subscribe and have a delivery every month - works out a lot cheaper than buying them from the supermarkets...

These dishwasher tablets can cut through the toughest of grease and grime. I don't need to rinse anything before putting it into the dishwasher. I've used other brands of tablets before, but these are unbeatable. Use as part of your dishwashing set-up with Finish Salt and Rinse Aid and you'll have sparkling dishes every time!

The best dishwasher tablets we buy. We have shopped around for the best prices and with free Prime delivery these can be good value. Always check the prices against your local store though as we have noticed that sometimes it it cheaper to buy them from the local store. Prime delivery does add convenience and is my preference these days.

I like these dishwasher tablets. They clean a lot better than the fairy tablets that I've tried as well as some own brand ones. These also seem to work better than the standard finish tablets. My dishes normally come out clean and very occasionally there's a bit of the gel stuff left but not enough to cause any problems!
Cleans well but is alittle overpriced

These work great, although I use them for "heavy" washes (i.e. after a roast or a particularly heavy dinner party!) and they work as much as any other tablet. Although these have less chemicals in, so I feel a bit more eco friendly, but can't help wondering if the fancy packaging and tablet design make you think you're getting something grander than a general dishwasher tablet? I mean, they all do the same job, but I don't know if these are any different to a cheaper or a supermarket brand. But they're cheaper than the supermarket so I'll keep some in the cupboard for stubborn washes :)

Ordered 80 pack of Quantum (Superior Clean and shine as pictured on Amazon) and received these. They are just as good and better for the environment so can't really complain to much. In-store 40 are £10 so getting 80 for £10 is a great price.

Received free sample of 4 was a little sceptical about seeing any improvement on my regular finish tablet but wow I’m impressed . Glasses definitely cane out shinier and everything seemed just that bit more sparkly and clean . really good that includes rinse aid as my compartment for it has broken so cant use it . Will definitely be switching to quantum .

Despite a good price personally I don't see a wow clean factor from this grade as it should the the best grade in its class. May buy again when price range is right but won't expect to give you super shiny dish than others as they all do the good job too.
This is a lovely product and cleans very well

There's not much I can write about this product:. - I've used these tablets many times with a great result each time. - major benefit is the inclusion of rinse aid. - I suspect that dishwasher salt is also included as I haven't had to add any to my dishwasher and I've been using it for 2+ years with no issues!

They do the job well, not much of a smell from them which is a shame as I like a nice scent from the dishes, glasses come out perfect and there are no water marks, great price and delivery from amazon as usual, the fairy ones are slightly better but only slightly, go for the best offer at the time!

Terrible product. Does not disintegrate in the machine and progressively gets worse at cleaning. I initially thought it was the machine and have wasted 5+ hours taking my machine apart and cleaning every aspect of it to find out that it was definitely the tablets. Not only have I wasted my time cleaning my machine in great detail, for the past week I have had to rewash every glass coming out of the machine as well as spend more money on expensive dishwasher cleaning products. Extremely disappointed as I thought Finish was a trusted and proper brand (hence why I spent so much money by comparison on this brands tablets and not a cheap alternative)
This is my favourite dishwasher tablet. Everything comes out sparkling clean and the dishwasher keeps clean and fresh too. A good size economical pack as well.

In my view Finish Quantum is the best dishwasher tablet on the market. It is the only formula that gives an excellent performance every time. The dishes, and glasses (which are always a worry for clouding) are always sparkling and cutlery pristine. It is also the only tablet I have found that deals with tea stains in cups and mugs properly. This buy was great value for money as well on an Amazon Deal.

I always buy these tablets, they are great value and clean a lot better than other brands at a similar price. Some heavily soiled items ( baking trays ) may require soaking before they are washed but it has no problems cleaning plates and bowls even the next day. I found that they also give a good shine to glasses compared to other dishwasher tablets that leave them with water marks.
By far the best dishwasher tablets. Much better than Fairy

The tablets often failed to fully dissolve even at the highest temperature wash, this meant I would need to rewash the dishes.. I do like the fact there is no fragrance so food does not taste of the wash tablets.. Other tablets in the 'Finish' range performed better and is more cost effective
these are daftly ecpensive anyway for what they do but repeat order makes them much better value and I can't forget them!

These tablets are better than the Fairy Platinum ones I've previously tried. They clean glasses brilliantly, I found with the Fairy tablets they left a strong soapy smell in the dishes whereas the Finish ones don't.. Very pleased. And in Subscribe & Save you can't get these conveniently delivered and with a saving. We found that 45 tablets last around two months as we don't use the dishwasher every day. The bag is resealable which helps prevent moisture getting in the bag and damaging the tablets.

Bought these recently for our dishwasher, they work really well. The pots are clean and shiny, without that rather odd smell that dishwashers sometimes leave or the unpleasant tactile feel that they sometimes impart.. So to summarise, these are good dishwasher tablets, at a reasonable price, that arrived quickly and undamaged. Excellent! Recommended.

I cannot fault this item. I used to buy the cheap branded dishwasher items. There was one mug, however much I washed it, it also had these brown leftover coffee stains on. It was really hard to scrub off by hand. By coincidence I got this item in a sale, and suddenly, those stains have disappeared. When I reverted back to the cheap brands, then stain returned.
Love this product. It clean very well but sometimes I still find some of the soap on my glasses. I dont know if the issue comes from my dish washer or from the product itself.
Cleaned dishes very well. No signs of grease or debris left on the baking tins . very pleased with the results.

The Quantum tablets are the best, they leave the dishes with a softer feel and the glasses look much brighter. Surprisingly after using other brands in my dishwasher, I had noticed that some times were becoming stained or cloudy. One wash with these and my cups were completely white again, no stains and they felt better. A lot of the cloudy areas on glasses had also disappeared.

We have used Finish Quatum Max for a few years now but this latest packet from Amazon arrived emblazoned as just Quantum. I queried this with Amazon customer services to be told they are the same product.. Well maybe they are but this is the first time that we have had issue with Finish dishwasher tablets. Every one we have used has not dissolved properly. We have only used 5 tablets and each and every one has left blobs of white and blue undissolved product on the plates and has also left the red dot completely undissolved. The majority of the items in the dishwasher needed a rinse to get the product off. After this happening 5 times I called Amazon. Is the product faulty? Is it a 'fake' batch?. Amazon customer services were polite and simply told me to throw the product away and they will refund the cost in full. They did not want pictures as evidence although I took some in case they did. They will also refer this issue to their 'buyers'. So to be honest I cannot recommend this product. I will now only buy Fairy
Bought at the beginning of the Coronavirus when people had panic bought therefore the price of this product was extortionate

This Quantum Regular tablet offers the convenience of just dropping the tablet into the dispenser and no wrapper to be removed. I wasn't very impressed with the quality of the tablets though as some of the solution leaked out of some of the tablets which obviously left them unusable.. BUT saying that we have used several of the various types of Finish dishwasher tablets and these perform consistently well, they leave our dishes clean and sparking. Regardless of which of the many types of Finish tablet we use, the results are always much better than the occasionally tried "Own Brand" supermarket tablets.. We never pay the ridiculously high 'full list price' and always look for offers on the opportunity to stock up cheap, usually at about a third of list.

We have gone through a pretty full range of dishwasher tablets over the years but these are pretty expensive so had been doubtful about whether they would be that much better. Well, they are. Great results and unless you live in a hard water area (we do) you can also save some money by not needing salt and finishing aid. We don't make that saving fully but we have reduced the usage of both and still get excellent results.

Everything to like, nothing to dislike, work better than 'which' top rated best buy dishwashing product! Does not makes glasses look etched!! Seem safe even for delicate items.. For particularly heinous dishwashing tasks, I sometimes use a second tab, this also effectively cleans the dishwasher as well. Don't use two tabs if washing bone handled style knives, as the cleaning solution is too strong for the handles, leaves a mark on the handle.. I have used these since they became available and now always choose these over other brands.

We've been using Finish Quantum Max tablets a while now and the results were great, we decide to buy from Amazon as they were a fair bit cheaper, what we got is a highly suspect product that has ruined some items. We have used Amazon's pack for about two weeks, so roughly 10-12 tablets worth and glasses that have been going in and out of the dishwasher for months suddenly looks as if they have been cleaned with a wire brush, they are totally ruined. Not to mention the residue which we've never had with previous Finish Quantum Max packs.. We are partly to blame however, there was a clear warning which against better judgement I ignored. Many of the tablets were significantly discoloured. The central red ball on many tablets isn't red, and on those that are red, it is very faded. I should never have used them, but I thought perhaps they were still fine, some things do discolour without being defective. We have bought a pack from our nearby supermarket to replace amazon's, to give you an idea of the colour difference I've attached some photos. I realise the pack we bought today is the lemon version, but focus on the central red ball. We were perhaps unlucky, but if you see this discolouration in your pack...DO NOT USE THEM!!!
I always use Finish Quantum tablets. Have tried Tesco brand and other brands too but find Finish have a best finish and dry better. The tablets do a brilliant job. I would not use any other brand.

You sometimes pay over the odds for a brand name, but this value pack is just that - good value - and as it was purchased on the Subscribe and Save promotion, then it was an even better deal.. Crockery does appear to be cleaner using these, so will look to purchase again

These are amazing value and do the best job in our dishwasher. You can trust that your dishes will be clean and the dishwasher will be in great shape. Been using these for years now and won't settle for any less given the value you get from subscribe & save.

DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT!!. The product is out of date (date of manufacturing is 03/05/2017). From the photo attached you can see that the capsule colours are not how they should look- a normal capsule should have white powder and a dark blue liquid colour. These capsules are yellow and light blue. Once I opened the packaging, I was hit with a terrible smell, the capsules themselves are sticky which should not be the case.. I bought these during the pandemic as there weren't any in stores available. What's worse is that this product is not eligible for a return and refund, so I wasted money on a product that is not fit for use.. I would not recommend anyone to buy this! Out of date chemicals can be very dangerous and god knows what it could do to my dishwasher so I can't even use these! You're better off buying this sort of a product in any supermarket store.

Having always used Finish Quantum this is THE dishwasher tablet. I’ve even tried Fairy but it does not patch the performance of the Quantum tablet. Very rarely do dishes or cutlery come out dirty. If they do, then the dishwasher is overcrowded!

Super impressed with these. I decided to invest in better dishwasher tablets after constantly getting the white residue on my dishes. These tablets leave everything clean and shiny, no need to add rinse aid or salt. Very happy and also good price here on Amazon.

These are the ones......all glasses, crocks and cutlery kept in tip top condition......especially glasses. And stainless steel saucepans too.....all come out glistening! Even oven shelves only need a quick going over with wire cleaner afterwards to end up shining like new.....but do it straightaway, or remnant grunge dries on and spoils all the dishwasher'so good work. BUT far too expensive unless you catch the very regular half-price offers or buy from Amazon.
Does the job and needed urgently

These are fake! Do not buy!
Great items and value for money, smell great too
cleans really well. have always used them

I have to admit, I wouldn't have expected much difference in performance between dishwasher tablets. However, the dishes really do seem to come out a lot cleaner with these tablets: fewer water spots, fewer instances of food residues left behind (sadly, I did experience with my previous tablets - which were also Finish brand, but the "three in one" variety). So, by far the best Finish brand product I have used to date, and very good result on my dishes.
Item arrived in poor condition as 7 of the tabs were damaged and the detergent had partially or completely leaked out rendering them unusable.
Over a quarter of the tablets have there casing broken, a waste of money on this purchase.
Product is out of date! I want a refund ASAP! Joke! 18/09/2017... It's now 17/11/2017!
Not worth the high price paid. Tablet doesn't disolve fully in the dishwasher
Not bad dies the job thank you
loved tablets. will always use them
Cleans well leaves everything streak fee
great quality product. I'm very happy
It does the job with no complaints.

Unless they are a total disaster or so spectacular they practically do the washing up for you, it is always going to be difficult to review dishwasher tablets. As one might expect, these fall firmly between the two extremes. They seem to work fine, but I can't say that I notice any unusually impressive effects. I still occasionally have to run dishes through the washer twice if there's stubborn food dried on, and my partner likes it that the wrappers dissolve so he doesn't have to fiddle with unwrapping them (although it's a mess if you grab a tablet when your hands are wet). At the moment they are selling for £7.72 as an add on item. The RRP is listed as £16.00 for 40 tablets (which surely no one would pay) so I'd say they represent decent value for an item that always strikes me as ridiculously expensive. But I'll still likely be sticking to cheaper own-brand versions since I can't see much difference in performance.
They got my dishes really clean - not much else you need from a dishwasher tablet I guess. And they small nice too.

A little more expensive than some tablets but they do the job very well. With some tablets I've used they don't clean as well on quick cycles. These appear to perform just as well whatever the cycle. No tea stains in cups or residue grease on cutlery, even without the support of a rinse aid. I've even used them when out of special salt and have haven't noticed any deterioration in cleaning.

This product is as good as other FInish tablets and better than Fairy. Giving it 4 starts though because, in terms of real performance, I don't see any difference between this and any other Finish tablets.

This product is easy to use, it cleans dishes well and there is no obvious residue. To be honest, though, I can't really tell the difference between the more expensive brands and the home brands. Nothing to complain of here, though.
We have a two year old dishwasher and it's always produced great results, upgrading to these tablets has produced no additional improvement, but they do a great job regardless.. 4 Stars
I use this brand a lot and I was interested to try a version that used less chemicals. Thus far, still cleaning well and I can see no difference between thus and the originals.

These dishwasher tablets are rather good - they're ready to put straight in and are unwrapped so you don't need to worry about any plastic to deal with... It dissolves well, cleans the dishes perfectly and we're really pleased with them! All in all, a good buy!

Easy open pack and tablets are ready to pop into the dishwasher, dishes are clean and like all dishwasher cleaning products glass can come out marked or not, so keep an eye on your glasses. Out of a whole pack of these tablets only one did not fully dissolve. The price may be more than own brands but it is down to personal choice.

These do their job well - dirty dishes come out clean, including those with bits of food or liquid stuck or burnt on. They may not be entirely necessary for a load that's only moderately dirty, such as crockery, but are worth using for tougher challenges.

I have noticed particles of food left behind on dishes after using these. I don't get that with the brand I normally use, a Which? best buy. Moreover, these are making glass tumblers go cloudy rather quickly.. At the price, you can do better. At about a quarter of the price of these per wash, you can do almost as well.

If this was a tin, it would do exactly as it says on it. However, it is more of a bag than a tin, yet it still manages to do its job admirably as advertised. This is a good price for 40 tablets, although keep an eye out for offers in your local supermarket. It leaves glasses and plates with a gleam and doesn't seem to cause any grief to my washing machine.

What can you really say about dishwasher tablets? This is a brand we often use, along with Fairy when the mood takes us (or the bargains). To be honest they work really well, nothing seems to remain stuck on the dishes apart from some really stubborn bits in awkward areas. Bottom line is that they work.

I've never found myself getting excited about washing up tablets before and I'm not going to start now, but these little fellas aren't bad. They're not the best as I still think the lemon scented Fairy tablets are better, but these will clean up your plates, pots and pans to the point where you could make the vicar a cup of tea and know that his cup will be spotless.

These odd little packs (they're wrapped in something like plastic which you leave on and which dissolves during the cycle) get the dishes, cutlery and especially the glasses cleaner than my regular tablets, but then my regular tablets are Tesco own brand at about half the price. I suppose it depends how important it is to you for your dishes to be shining clean.

In terms of cleaning power, I can see no difference between these and the normal version of Finish Quantum. The only difference is the price and the chemicals used.. Strictly speaking, the price is the same, but you get fewer tablets.. So if you want to help the environment, add an extra star and buy these. If saving money is more your priority, then buy the normal version.

Finish dish-washing products have always set the standard for machines since the early days of powder and 'Rinse Aid' . Some feel that of late their products are not as effective, but are a lot more expensive than previously. Not so with the 'Power and Pure Quantum' which gives excellent results.. My wife is impressed enough to want to change to this product

OK you can't beat Finish products, in my opinion they are without doubt the best dishwashing product on the market.. This tablet is good, no wrappers, so you have to make sure that you seal the bag each time, to stop them getting sticky.. I have to say though that even though there is rinse aid in each tablet, I don't see a lot of difference between the all in one finish power and the pure quantum.. But my dishes and glasses were spotless so there's no complaints here.

As you don't need to unwrap these, they are simple to use. They produce great results, we haven't suffered with bits of plastic stuck in the water jets as other tablets have done and the dishes smell clean and fresh. One slight problem we have suffered occasionally is that the tablet wrapping does not unwrap, which means running the whole process again. Although we do have an old dishwasher (14 years old to be precise), so I cannot be too harsh as this has happened with other 'wrapped' tablets in the past. I may be a little harsh with only awarding 4 stars, but can't justify 5 due to the couple of potential issues above.

Liked these for a couple of reasons, one because you don't have to take the tablets out of their wrapper when you put them in the dishwasher - the material just dissolves in the wash. They also smell quite nice and I can't deny that all my stuff came out of the wash very clean.. Only other thing I'd say is that, amusingly, the word 'dishwasher' doesn't appear on the packet! I suppose the shiny glass on the packet's cover lets you know what they're for...

Finish Quantum tablets are more expensive than standard washing up tablets but they give consistently good results. Finish Power and Pure Quantum are no exception. In use they are easy to handle being wrapped in dissolvable plastic packets and they give cirst class results in use - dishes, cutlery, glasses and china mugs all came out of the wash sparkling clean with no smearing or marks apparent. As a bonus the 'wet dog' smell that you can often get using cheaper products was eliminated. Great product and well worth paying a bit more for... Recommended.

All Quantum tabs are easy to use; but the "power and pure" ones get the crockery, cutlery and especially glassware sparkling clean without having to use the highest temperature setting. I use the economy setting on my dishwasher, which is about 60-65 degrees C. It's a short cycle and with these tabs, you get good results with the eco setting. The only reason for 4 rather than 5, is that they are pricey.. The other types Quantum tabs, aren't as good at lower temperature and I find thy work best at 70+ degrees and preferably with a prewash mode (even if you are not using any detergent for the prewash section, and just putting the Quantum tab in the main wash section of your dishwasher's detergent hold)

I have used many different dishwashing tablets over the years, and I always come back to Finish as in my opinion it is the best. I usually use the ones in their individual wrappers, and I can't really say that not having to open a wrapper is an advantage apart from not having to throw it away. I do use salt and rinse aid in my dishwasher, even though you don't need to with these tablets, but I live in a very hard water area. Personally I don't think you can go wrong with Finish, but I have taken 1 star off because I do think they are overpriced.

I usually buy whichever dishwasher tablet is on offer in the supermarket (and there always seems to be an offer on dishwasher tablets!) and, by and large, they perform well and do what's needed. These new Finish tablets are definitely a cut above what I have been using and appear to give better results in terms of cleaning burnt on food and giving a smear-free finish on glasses. But, being honest, I am not sure the difference is sufficiently noticeable to get me to change my shopping habits - if these are on offer, I wouldn't hesitate to buy them again but probably wouldn't pay more for these.

I wasn't put off from trying this product by Dave Gorman's comments on his TV show, and I'm glad of that. This is a fine dishwasher tablet, that cleans all types of dishes with all types of food residue, without having left residue once. It even has the nicest scent of any tablet I've ever used. The only reason it drops a star is that the instructions warn you not to use it free in the washer, but to put it in the tablet chamber. This may seem like logic but I have a slimline washer that usually has something in the way of the chamber, and can't always put the tablet in there. If you want to ignore their instruction, though, you take your chances.

I do prefer the finish brand to other Dishwaster tablets. I think they do give a superior wash & things come out looking cleaner & more sparkling than other brands & I find that my glasses are cared for better. One other brand (well known for washing up liquid) left all my glasses terribly scratched.. I cant say that I have noticed any better cleaning from these quantum tabs than the ordinary ones, I don't think I would pay the extra as my dishes are clean & sparkling just from the normal tabs.. One thing I have noticed is that my melamine glasses have been left with a chalky film on them, so I'm having to wash these by hand. But other than that these tabs work very well

I've used various brands of dishwasher tablets before and have generally found them to be much the same, with the only large difference being their price. However, as my dishwasher is starting to show its age, it doesn't always get things as shiny and bright as it perhaps once did. In particular, if I set it off with a full load this can be evident. Having used these tablets for two weeks now, I can say that I'm pleased with the results. The instances of plates/pans being left with residues of dirt on them has been much less, if any, which is very helpful for me as is saves having to give anything a secondary wipe down. Whether on heavy pans or delicate glasses, the results have all been very good and I will continue to use these tablets in my dishwasher.

I have a good dishwasher, and normally use Finish Quantum wrapped tablets in it, and it always gets everything clean. So I decided to try these, and they get everything clean. So what's the difference?. I had thought that doing away with the wrapper would be a good thing, but as I often have wet hands when loading the dishwasher, and these tablets have a soluble covering, they get a bit sticky, and all stick together in the pack. On this matter, I'd sooner have them wrapped.. Finish say these contain fewer harsh chemicals, and I guess I'll take their word for it, but I expect that formulation will carry over to the wrapped tablets too.. So, overall, the advantage of a tablet ( no messing round with softener or salt or rinse aid) but maybe not so suited to my lifestyle. The great wrapped or not debate continues.

After using one of these tablets, in place of my usual 'budget' brand, the dishwasher came out absolutely spotless and shiny. The 'Quantum' tablets do an excellent job on the crockery and utensils, too! Another advantage of these tablets is that their outer skin dissolves in the dishwasher, so you don't have to wrestle with a tablet wrapped in cellophane each time you use one. The handy re-sealable bag also works very well.. Verdict. I'll keep a pack of these handy and use them occasionally for giving the dishwasher a good clean out on a long cycle and for when we have a 'difficult' wash to do, rest of the time I'll use the cheapies.. One small point. Regardless of whether a tablet contains salt, you still need to protect the heating elements in your washer by putting dishwasher salt in the special compartment.

Finish tends to be my product of choice when it comes to dishwashing tablets, which is why I was keen to try this new version of its quantum product, which supposed contains fewer chemicals and gets a better clean.. When I opened the packet I found the smell very artificial and not particularly pleasant - I actually prefer the lemon quantum product on that front, but that's really the only criticism I'd make about it. The gel tablets are the same size as other Finish products and fit into my dishwasher compartment without any problems. I've used them on a mix of heavily used pots and pans, including a grill pan and I was happy with the result. I'm not sure that it's any better than the rest of the Finish range, but it got the dirt off and left my cutlery and glassware spot free.. I like the design of the packaging - it's useful to have a resealable bag and I like the fact that it doesn't clog up my bin or recycling bag when I've finished with it.

These tablets are wrapper-free which is nice. It's always a bit of a faff tearing off the corner of the packaging and coaxing the tablet out of the bog standard varieties. Plus, its a little better on the environment (although getting rid of the dishwasher would probably work better!).. We live in a hard water area - whether that makes a massive difference I'm not sure. I will be honest, I'm still using rinse aid and salt with these as its habit so can't provide a completely unbiased review. I will say that my crockery and cutlery is nice and clean, shiny and don't need to be re-washed as they have needed in the past with other tablets. We tend to rinse our stuff anyway, but our cutlery is coming out nicer and isn't showing the brown rust marks it has a tendency to show us up with.. If you want ease and don't mind the price, these are a good bet.

These are undoubtedly excellent dishwasher tablets but they are extremely expensive. The RRP is £16.00 for 40 tablets, although Amazon are selling them at a much reduced price of £7.72 (although as usual you will need to place an order for a minimum of £10.00 to qualify for super saver delivery). I have owned various brands of dishwashers for over 20 years and I have always used an inexpensive brand of dishwasher tablets without any problems. I normally use Tesco everyday value tablets which cost only £1.60 for 30 tablets! I have previously used Lidl's tablets again without any problems. I have no doubt that the Finish tablets include ingredients which the cheaper tablets do not, for example, limescale protection and salt and rinse aid which help to deliver a good shine. I live in a soft water area so I am not bothered about limescale protection. As I am normally washing ordinary, everyday dishes I am not bothered about a brilliant shine. For these reasons I will continue using an inexpensive brand of tablets. I am not prepared to pay such a high price for what might be a slightly better product.

Finish is my dishwasher tablet of choice to be honest so was pleased to be able to give these the once over. I normally buy finish all in one and on subscribe and save the price cannot be beaten.. Last month I used fairy all in one super tablets which were given me to try by a friend who was not keen. These tablets left hot chocolate grime and bits of stuff on plates and were consigned to the bin.. I popped one of these bad boys in my dishwasher on economy cycle putting the most baked on grime slow cooker pan on my shelf I think I have ever put in. I also put in tassimo stained hot chocolate cups which had been left overnight to dry together with cutlery and plates.. What I expected and what I got were two different things. Everything was spotless not a hint of stain, a particle of food to be seen. Plus point was that it all smelled good as well no chemical eye watering stink you can sometimes get which can leave taint. Well done finish

First of all, I like the convenience of not having to unwrap the tablet, you just put the whole thing in the dispenser in the dishwasher. I've had ones where you have to unwrap them and half the time I drop the tablet on the floor when trying to get it out and then couldn't use it.. Worked well on dried on food, tea stains (green and herbal teas, we haven't tried it with ordinary tea as we don't drink it). The glasses and cutlery came up sparkling and streak-free. It has a pleasant smell and the dishes are clean. Worked very well on saucepans and casserole dishes.. We live in a very hard water area and despite this having a salt and rinse-aid function, sometimes there was still a little bit of residue, as if the Finish hadn't quite dissolved properly - although I think that may be a fault of the hard water rather than this product. I'd certainly use it again.. I dislike their advert though, less chemicals because it has oxygen - oxygen is a chemical ;)

Finish Quantum is still about the best to get dishes clean. I find the 'eco-tablets' are often not very effective or leave residues. These work and are worth the extra pennies. Even wine glasses wash fine on 40 degrees C with no residues left or partially dissolved tablets. Highly recommended

When I moved into my flat late last year, I became the proud user of a dishwasher for the very first time. It has been a revelation, but the first time I went to buy the detergent, I was taken aback by the prices of the leading brands, and opted for a supermarket own brand - which worked out around 10 pence per tablet as opposed to 36-40 pence for the big brands, including Finish.. I have been perfectly happy with my own brand (apart from the smell) so I was interested to try this product - at nearly four times the price, would it be four times as good?. With no inner wrapper, first impressions of the block are that it feels slightly squidgy and sticky - like a gummy sweet, so I guess it would be even more important that usual to keep the tablets out of the reach of children/pets. It's also really important to handle them with dry hands.. As I live on my own during the week, I only run the dishwasher every couple of days so things do get dried on whilst waiting. The tablets removed all food debris efficiently, and left the dishes shining. There's more shine to my cutlery with these tablets than with my usual ones, and no overpowering smell of detergent when I open the dishwasher either.. So, to sum up, I like these tablets, and would buy them if I came across them at a reasonable price (say 15-20p per tablet) but the premium price doesn't mean the performance is increased by the same amount.

We bought our first Bosch Exxcel line dishwasher about a month ago, and like most it came with 2 of the above tablets.. However, we soon realised this was a quality machine with a large salt and rinse aid reservoir, and started to look into the benefits of having these kept separate.. A trip to the local discount store (Prop. Mr. L.Idl) showed that I could get 'not all in one' tablets for the huge price of 7p each, and enough rinse aid and salt that at current consumption (we're a couple with 2 dogs and no kids!) should last the rest of the year. They were about a pound each.. The rinse aid, I can see could be combined successfully in a tablet, but salt, not so. My Dad used to work in a hospital and reminded me that the only way to get soft water is salt, raw salt, and lots of it. For this reason, I argue that salt in a separate hopper in the machine is far and above the best way to get the soft water needed for a good wash.. In essence, the finish tablets are gtreat - but the discount store alternative is so much cheaper, and almost I'd argue a superior wash, I wouldn't buy them specially.

These are excellent. Some of my glassware has been getting cloudy using the standard Finish dishwasher tabs, but the bloom has lifted, and my other tableware, cookware, saucepans and cutlery are also gleaming.. It's given them a squeaky clean feeling.. Excellent product - highly recommended

what more can i say ill never use anything else! the reults you get with this one tablet are amazing. perfectly clean streak free glassess, baking trays with built in dirt are spotless and shiny with 1 wash.

A great dishwasher product from Finish. The dishes come out sparkling. The dissolvable skin on these seems much better than on other tablets i've used previously and therefore none of the tablet remains after the cycle.

Brilliant! These tablets gave a sparkling & brand new look to my dishes & cutlery & glasses. I could not believe the difference. It was as if I had bought new ones!. Also that it's a bit more environmentally friendly than other dish washing tablets makes me happier.. The only thing if say to improve it is to make it 100% natural & environmentally safe.

Finish simply and reliably provide tablets which wash my dishes clean. They are my brand of choice, and will continue to be. Other brands simply do not live up in terms of performance and I have ended up having to wash dishes a second time. Highly recommended.

I hate washing up, loathe it. Enter the dishwasher. Load it, put the tablet in and press the button. Now all you have to worry about now are the third degree burns you get unloading the dishes.. Dishwasher tablets have improved over the years. The best quality ones have all the cleaning stuff in them, rinse aid etc. Another hassle has been removed by the fine people at Finish. No more pesky little wrappers.. This product contains less chemicals to harm the environment. Something which is a good thing. But there is no lessening of the cleaning power. Nice one finish.. Streak free glassware, squeaky clean crockery. All you need now are asbestos hands or burn cream...
I have tried a range of makes of dish washer tablets over the years and of all of these Finish seems to be the best. I therefore highly recommend this product.
The dishes emerged from the washer squeaky clean; they're a premium product priced accordingly, and as expected they produce much better results than the budget ones that I usually get.

I really cannot say too much about these Finish Power and Pure Quantum dishwasher tablets, but they do make a real difference to your pots and cutlery also I have found that my dishwasher looks a little cleaner too.
Usually use fairy platinum, this product is similar in efficiency. However this is not as strongly scented which I prefer. Pans, plates and glasses came out sparkling.

Have used many brands but these do seem to do it all. Very good end result and no wrappers to worry about. I also don't bother with salt or rinse aid when using these, which is one less thing to faff with. Glassware comes out 'as new' and tea stains are also all removed, something hard to do when washing by hand I find!

I have reviewed the Finish All in One Dishwasher tablets elsewhere, and although they're good, the Finish Power and Pure seems to improve things a notch or two; no residue on glass products, and a thorough cleaning job on even pretty ingrained things. I got a free pack from Amazon Vine, but it's a product that I am happy to endorse and use again in the future, even though, as I say, they're not cheap - but the time-saving convenience and strength of the product outweighs such considerations.

My boyfriend had been threatening to change back to powder as tablets were costly, these have changed his mind! Everything comes out of the dishwasher so clean and even inside the dishwasher itself is clean and dry. These are easy to use, leave no residue from the tablet or residue on the plates. I would highly recommend these and will definitely be buying some.

Having used these 3 times now in our dishwasher I am impressed with the results. They remove tea stains, leave plates lovely and clean and glasses shiny. I had recently started to notice the cheaper Finish dishwasher tablets were leaving grit in cups and some mugs were left stained. These tablets, although more expensive, really do a good job and in my opinion it's worth paying the extra.

These are finest tablets from finish. There is absolutely everything there to keep the dishes clean and beautiful. I am also pleased that despite complex design of the tablet, it does dissolve well. I have come across dissolving issues in the past with other brands. There is enough power in these tablets to clean even dirtiest and nastiest stains.

We've just had to invest in a new dishwasher, and these tablets arrived on the same day it was fitted. This does mean that comparisons are not valid - maybe the new dishwasher is better at cleaning than the old one - but the results from using these tablets have been excellent - glasses I thought were dulled by age have been transformed.They are more expensive than the cheaper brand we were using - but I don't think we'll go back.

I've tried cheaper dishwasher tablets and found you are more likely to run into problems with them. Either the tablets don't dissolve very well or they just don't give your dishes that sparkly clean feel.. I can't fault Finish. I've tried this style before when it was on offer at the supermarket and they do the job perfectly. Surprisingly expensive though so you'll actually end up saving more in the long run by buying in bulk. Another great 'add-on' from Amazon!

We have used Finish dishwasher products in the past and were interested to see if these power and pure tablets would be of the usual high quality. I can report that we were not disappointed, in fact we were impressed with the greatly improved performance of these tablets, with everything from the dishwasher coming out perfect. Having tried these tablets we are very likely to continue using them in preference to other Finish products.

A good product currently at a very good price. This works very well, and I've no complaints at all. Everything put into the dishwasher came out clean and sparkling, just as it should. These tablets have a self-dissolving outer cover, and combine both water softener and rinse aid, so you don't have the inconvenience of buying them and topping your machine up. I've had no problems at all with tea and coffee staining, and the fact that it helps protect my dishwasher from lime scale is good too, as I live in an area with very hard water. Good product!

Firstly, fantastic minimal packaging. Tiniest possible package and the contents individual with no wraps to tear open. Quick seal bag, perfect.. Tried them now on every single setting (we do use them all) and no problems at all. We don't add anything else to our machine except a little Salt top up as we have super hard water.. Glasses come out super clear and sparkly, plates and pans de-grease with ease. Even the tupperware has stopped picking up the pink hue from tomato based sauces etc.. Would choose this as our first choice.

"Finish" wax positively lyrical in their description of how amazing these tablets are - rather difficult to match their fulsome praise for their own product, but I won't argue insofar as the tablets are pleasant to use, being encased in a dissolvable gel, so no mucky powder on your hands or tiresome plastic packet to fight your way into - and the results seem to be excellently clean shiny dishes and glasses, though I suspect that some of this has to do with a) the quality of your machine and, more importantly, b) whether you bother to clean the filter. Anyway, nice product, and you get what you pay for.

It may seem like dishwasher tablets are trivial, but these really are great. We have tried many tablets from supermarket own (including the lauded Aldi) to fairy etc but tried these as part of amazon vine and I must say they are very good- so good in fact even my dad remarked on how much he likes these tablets!. We have had issues in the past with poor rinsing (even with full rinsing agent) and a fine residue being left on glasses in particular meaning as soon as you poured a fizzy drink in the glass it went flat.. this has not happened with these tablets, squeaky clean and no problems with carbonated drinks which reduces the hand washing and most items come out perfect and practically dry (unlike with other brands) so we will be repurchasing these despite the higher cost than the own-brands.

Unlike other Finish tablets I have tried these Power & Pure Quantum ones are a loose powder which comes within a soluble plastic outer. As one other reviewer mentioned, this does mean you have to keep them dry, but the advantage is that I do think they dissolve better in the wash as they powder is loose once the outer dissolves and not a brick like lump! We have tried these for a few washes now and are impressed with the results, they seem to leave the load completely clean (my husband's favourite thing is going through the dishwasher looking for rejects!) so we will be sticking with them.

FINISH did it again, coming up with a newer and more powerful dissolving tab for your dishwasher. I do not have a scientific background, so cannot comment about the active oxygen, but the result is there – everything comes out clean and sparkly. It seems to be working with less chemicals, so one can feel better about the whole process.. As with all the other FINISH tabs wrapped in the dissolving wrapper, you must be careful to have dry hands when handling them, but that’s the only limitation.. Overall: a great new product – thank you FINISH.

these were practical, time saving and efficient.. they do not require the individual tablet packaging removing before use.. they washed really well, gave a really clean and sparking result.. i have tried various other brands but have not found them to be anywhere near as good as these.. they dissolve completely and there is no residual marks on glasses.. although a bit more expensive than others, with a product like this it seems you really do get what you pay for.. i will be buying more of these!

and eversuch a clever creation! I'm disproportionately excited about this great product.. The three different elements in the self contained pouch that self-dissolves without other product or additions.. Top class stuff....... Yes this comes at a price...... but the quality is undeniable!. I had my doubts about the pricing but the glasses and cutlery come out looking spotless, better than at initial purchase.. They clean cookware, crockery, glasses, cutlery and the dishwasher itself better than anything else I've known.. You'll not be disappointed.....And the proof is that's what we'll be buying for our home long into the future.

I used to use Finish tablets, but switched to own brand because of the increasing cost and because there wasn't much distinction in results. However having tried these I may well be persuaded back to buying Finish. The results on glassware particularly are very good.. The convenience of just dropping a tab into the dispenser without unwrapping it is balanced out by a need to keep the packet airtight, otherwise they start to dissolve.. Very good results, I haven't yet had to rewash or rerun the dishwasher because an item wasn't clean first time, so from that point of view they are quite economical.

We were using finish tablets up until about a year ago in our Smeg washer and we found they were leaving nasty residue on all the cutlery and plates. You'd find hard white lumps on everything, so we stop using them. When we saw they had a new range out, we thought we give them another go. Wow, what a difference! No idea what they've done but these tablets are 10 times better than the old finish tablets. The plates and cutlery are stunningly clean, no residue, everything is spotless and the even the inside of the machine looks bright and sparkly! I couldn't recommend these more!

These are so simple to use, life gets easier. You don't need to unwrap the contents, just drop it in and set the machine going. If using these all the time, you can also stop using added salt and rinse aid as they do the entire job at once, including cleaning your machine. Of course your dishwasher quality will also have an effect, but these are really good, albeit expensive, although without salt and rinse aid, you save something anyway.. The product is available on Amazon subscription which provides further discount and also allows you to choose the 'flavour', as they call it, and also the number of 'cubes' you want per purchase. I'm tempted to suggest to Amazon that a 'random' choice of flavour would be fun in a subscription. You'd never know what you'd get ... :)

These tablets have everything you need in one neat package, and it is a real pleasure to slot one into the dishwasher without having to unwrap it first. I tested them on a cottage pie dish that had been left overnight and not soaked, and the dish gleamed with that "ting" that really clean glass has.. Glasses are themselves very good and not a bit streaky, even the cheap pint glasses from ASDA that we use every day for drinks of water come out sparkling.. The only thing I would say is that these are top of the range dishwasher tablets, and that is reflected in the price. They are expensive compared to almost everything else. I do think that they prove the adage "you get what you pay for" and if they are ever on special offer at Tesco I snap them up.

I have had many different types of tablet, usually the all in one type, and in fact have had the dishwasher for seven years and have never had to put separate salt or rinse in to it as a result. What attracted me to these is the packaging - I like the way you don't have to unwrap the tablets - the near-invisible wrapping just dissolves in the machine.. It is of course vital to keep the tablets in a dry place otherwise the wrapping will dissolve, and also you need to dry your hands before taking one out of the packet.. The washing power seems excellent to me although others have commented on the way they can take the sparkle off softer types of glass. For me,, that just seems par for the course - most glassware is pretty cheap these days and can be replaced and I certainly wouldn't put any of our better glassware into the dishwasher anyway. OK, so some tea-stains need to be wiped off afterwards but do it when you just take the cups out of the machine and it won't be a problem.. A very good product - if you can get it at the right price it's one to go for .

Having appreciated the results of previous Finish dishwashing products, I was keen to try these. I rather liked the idea of cleaning with fewer chemicals as it is more ecologically friendly, and I'm all for that if the results are on par. The first thing I noticed was the tablets are in that new dissolving wrapper, so there is no plastic wrapper to open and dispose of, so right off the bat, there is reduced waste. The second thing I noted was that it said it was fine to use in my shorter, lower temp eco-wash setting, which was another thumbs up. lastly, while it is an all n one type, the back of the package did state that using rinse aid would improve performance, which is different from most all in ones. I'm guessing this may be related to it having fewer chemicals in it, and would depend on your water area (harder water tends to leave more spots).. I live in a medium water area, and did not use any added rinse aid, washed on the eco-wash setting except for two occasions, where very dirty pans were included in the wash. The dishes came out clean and free of spots each and every time, and a light pleasant fragrance greeted my nose when I opened the dishwasher. I was very impressed with the results and will definitely be adding this to my list of household purchases.

Finish Quantum Max shine and protect -2 Pack of 30 (60 Dishwasher Tablets). I reviewed the previous FINISH Power and Pure Quantum Dishwasher Tablets last year and gave it a 5 star rating based on extended tests.. Benckieser have brought out this latest improved FINISH in 2015 - it works as well as last years variant in our 14 year old dishwasher (which still runs at 55C).. As dishwashers become more ecological / energy efficient ( lower water volumes / lower wash temperatures/shorter wash times ) the demands on the diswasher cleaner product become greater. Cleaning is a blend of chemical energy ( the product) ; thermal energy (the temperature of cleaning) , mechanical energy ( how well the water is jetted onto the dishes) and time ( how long the cleaning fluid is in contact with the dishes - soaking improves penetration of the soils). I note that they have added a protein digesting enzyme to assist soil breakdown at temperatures close to 40C.. To us , the product was as good , if not better than the last one in our older style machine .. I would expect that the new product will show up better than the previous incarnation in the most modern ecologically orientated machines.. What I like about the product is the individually packed tablet ( coating dissolves off in the wash) with a combined cleaner and rinse aid in one package. The pre tablet technologies ( powder or liquid) were messy and needed 3 separate product ( Cleaner , rinse aid , salt) .Salt may still be required in very hard water areas. In our latest tests with well baked on pie crust , wine glasses with lipstick , and aged tea stains ( I used to work in the industry 30 years ago designing the original powder and liquid products - somewhat messy - so I added my own test pieces ) the product performed well. The glassware came out pristine.. Rate as 5 star - Highly recommended

This is a high-quality (and quite expensive) dishwasher tablet that gives very good results. Whether it is worth the extra cost over own-brand products is something that is going to vary according to the make of dishwasher, the hardness of the local water, how dirty the washing-up is when it goes into the machine and how long it's left there before being washed.. If you're using a less expensive product and you're not happy with the results your dishwasher is giving you then Finish Quantum Powerball Regular is definitely worth a try.

These produce an excellent result and I find that the tablets always fully dissolve - occasionally other brands we use don't (although that's probably as much to do with our old dishwasher perhaps). They are pleasantly scented too (by which I mean they are very subtle) and easy to store due to their compact size. However while they do give an excellent finish I question whether the extra outlay for these comparatively expensive dishwasher tablets is worth it; in my view cheaper brands do a pretty good job anyway. However, if a truly gleaming finish is important to you then perhaps the extra is justified.

I can't buy these at my Sainsbury's yet and they claim to have nine power actions including tea stain removal - useful for me! Other actions include machine limescale protection and a shine on glasses. Several more functions than the classic powerball. Compared tot he all in one it has added shine and is wrapper free. Worked well when I tried them with my new dishwasher. Not sure about using it on the eco setting - it says for best results use on 50 or 55 degree C programmes.

I have been using these now for a good few days so can leave an honest review. The first major thing I noticed with these is how squeaky clean it leaves dishes and particularly glass ware. Greasy residues left over from some solid chalky tablets have disappeared with this one. I tested one load with some particularly greasy stained homemade curry sauce and everything came out hyper clean and non greasy. I'm very impressed with how clean it leaves the dishwasher too and I nice clean smell. The only reason I have given four stars is on two washes there was some residue left over from the tablet in the draw dispenser but not sure if this is our dishwashers fault. Highly recommended dishwasher tablets!

There are plenty of different dishwasher tablets on the market. It's a choice between brand loyalty and ultimately price. With the quantums, the one handy feature is that they don't come sealed in their own little packets (saving waste). I did find these tablets to perform better than the standard ones. I was left with clean puddles of water instead of dirty ones. They're good tablets but i think they may be a tad overpriced.

We normally use Finish Powerball tablets so were keen to try these out - in use they do a good job and I couldn't really fault how they performed in terms of cleaning. The wrapper free design is also easier to use of course. However as soon as we started using them we noticed that glasses which previously had no dishwasher marks started to exhibit them - and this after the first use. I suspect it was because of the extra salt but I'm not sure (our dishwasher was already full of salt and these quantum tabs have an additional salt action so maybe that was it). Anyway, I'm not 100% sure so I'm only knocking one star off - your mileage may vary. Given a choice I probably wouldn't buy these more expensive tabs over the cheaper ones...

These tablets are badged as "Quantum", "Power Gel" and "Powerball"... A lot of this stuff is snake oil territory - they clean dishes very well, without blitzing the glassware (although we've only been using them for a few days), and leave the dishwasher smelling clean but not highly perfumed (like the Fairy tablets that we were using prior to these).. Resealable packaging. I've docked one star for the price - you can buy supermarket own-brand tablets for less, of course. As we all know, those adverts and groovy packaging don't come for free.. For those in medium-soft water areas (up to 26 degrees hardness), the tablets have some salt in them that is supposed to remove the need to use separate salt in the dishwasher, but I didn't take the chance since we live in a very hard water area, and kept the dishwasher topped up with salt.

I've been using the standard finish tablets for years and was generally happy with them.. However these are much better and I immediately saw the difference. Glass, ceramics and pots are visibly shiner when they come out of the dishwasher. Pans that needed to be soaked and scrubbed before putting in the dishwasher now only need a soak. A dish that was used for pasta bake had hard blackened cheese stuck to the sides. I soaked it for an hour or so and without any other cleaning put it in the dishwasher. It came out sparkling. This never happened with the standard tablets. It also gets through grease pretty well.. It's only a small thing, but the fact these don't come in a wrapper is really nice.. Overall a definite upgrade from the standard tablets. They are a little expensive, but they do cut down on need to pre-scrub hard to clean dishes.

Finish Quantum Powerball tablets have a pleasant lemony smell. The first thing I noticed about them was that you do not need to unwrap the tablet before placing in the dispenser, which is great if you want to keep caustic chemicals off your fingers. The tablets, which take the form of little plastic parcels, appear to consist of three ingredients: white powder, a red powder and blue gel. The pack explains that the white bit is a 'powerful detergent', the red ball 'fights spots and watermarks for a dazzling shine' and the power gel 'delivers a pre-soaking action for a clean so clean it shines.' No mention of where the salt is.. For best results, it recommends washing at 50-55°. For 30 min washes, it recommends placing the tablet in the bottom of the dishwasher rather than in the dispenser.. My wash came out lovely and clean with these tablets but then it usually does with cheap Aldi dishwasher tablets. As for tea stain removal, which is advertised on the back of the Finish pack, they worked reasonably well - but I can't say they were any better than Finish All-in-1 tablets Finish All In 1 Lemon Sparkle 78 Dishwasher Tabletsor Aldi tablets. I find effective tea stain removal to be associated more with the length of the wash and the hotness of the water rather than with the particular brand of detergent. Wth regards to sparkle of glasses, I didn't find any difference between this product and regular Finish or Aldi tablets. Neither did this tablet rejuvenate glasses previously fogged by constant dishwashing to any great extent. I find the addition of rinse aid is the key to ensuring glasses keep sparkling, rather than a particular detergent.. Many brands include salt in their tablets as a time-saving measure, but I prefer to add my own salt because I don't like any of it getting onto the cups or glasses and slightly tainting my beverages. So the incorporated salt wasn't a great advantage for me. That said, I didn't detect any saltiness on the cups or glasses after using these tablets.The other drawback is, if you wish to use just half a tablet for a quick wash, or in the interests of economy, there is no way of breaking these things in half. These tablets do have one advantage over cheap dishwasher tablets - all the tablet always disperses in the wash and you never get a bit of half-desolved tablet stuck to your cutlery or crockery.. Having used Finish All-in-1 and Aldi dishwasher tablets I couldn't really find any function in this packet of Finish Powerball tablets which would encourage me to pay the premium cost. I have a suspicion that dishwashing detergent is pretty much just powder detergent and the fancy additives and packaging is purely marketing tactics to facilitate charging a higher price.. Finish Quantum Powerball and Finish Pure Quantum, as far as I can see, are pretty much identical but the latter is more expensive. Pure boasts `less chemicals' (which seems an odd claim because what is a dishwasher tablet but chemicals, and if there's less of them, I appear to be getting less for my money.) But I guess this is a bid to appeal to green consumers. According to the packet, the chemical composition of Quantum Powerball and Quanyum Pure is identical, save that the latter doesn't contain `phosphonates'. These are rather ungreen, de-incrusting chemicals that can clog up your machine .So, if this is a concern for you, you might want to consider Pure Quantum. They perform exactly the same. I'll be sticking to Aldi tablets, which I can snap in half - being green as well as cheaper.. Both these tablets work fine and are wrapper-free, but at 20p per tab, both are overpriced, in my opinion.. Update, September 2015 after using several packs of this, I did wonder whether they would not clog up my kitchen drain as the cheaper ones do, but I have just had to shove my hand down and dispel a great clump of it, so there is no difference in that respect.

Sorry Finish, you clean brilliantly, even my burnt on lasagne, but you just don't smell as nice as my Fairy Dishwasher Pods when I open my machine. Maybe you have a lemon scented version but it's going to be tough to pry me away from my Fairy.
I live in a very hard water area. These are good dishwasher tablets and clean well, however I still need to add both rinse aid and salt to get a watermark free finish on my glassware and plastics.
