Ever since I was a kid my mom thought me that Finish is the best and as an adult I was often price led. This one was an eco led, but the price was right too.. But, it doesn't give you that freshly washed smell and it's not as good as ”ultimate” Finish products.
Seem to do a pretty good job and eco friendly. Tablets do stick together a bit once the package has been opened

Unfortunately these 0% Finish tablets do not suit my slimline dishwasher.. Even when I use half a tablet per wash, it still leaves my "cleaned" items with a white residue, so have to hot rinse everything in the sink afterwards.. Have spent a lot of extra energy (electricity, water and physical) trying to work with these tablets!. I've now resorted to crushing some into powder and will just add a tablespoon to my dishwasher per wash. If that doesn't help I'll give away the rest and try a different brand.. If you have a slimline dishwasher and still want to try these, then I suggest buying the smallest pack you can find first.. I hope my review has helped someone in that regard.
Cleans beautifully and happy that finish now have eco friendly tablets, I will be purchasing these regularly
Work very well. With them being sent free, my silicone kitchen stuff no longer takes on the taste of the tablets and can be washed in the dishwasher. (Instead of hand washed).

Just as good as other finish products, powerful, but without unwelcome scent of chemical lemon. I only buy these dishwasher tablets because I don't like using dinnerware and cutlery with chemical scent. I would definitely recommend this product.

Finish Quantum tablets are usually excellent but the quality of this product was very poor. All the tablets were stuck together and many were leaking. The audacity of paying money for something to clean something that is designed in its very self to clean something was too much for me to cope with. After 4 minutes of therapy I returned to reject my earlier sentiments and found happiness in the fact that my dishwasher could remain sparkly fresh, with an element of cheeky chappy persona, whilst maintaining a streak-free shine to my forks and knives and spoons a plates and dwarf plates and dishes and pans and pots and cups, the list is endless, the streaks came to an end, however. Clean my up Scotty. I love paying money that I earned from my job at the bakery, specialising in rubber duck shaped confectionary, such as cakes, chocolate gnomes, and garden party entrails. One out of five stars would be given if this product was bad, but five out of five was given because this product has been potentially the most good thing I have ever purchased from my money made at the fishing and leisurewear store (got the sack from the bakery as I accidentally crafted a mallard with the retinal complexity of a swan). Best Buy, true Line, smells great, After Eight.

This product seemed to do the job. I don’t think my dishwasher needed a few clean as it’s only a few months old and we live in a soft water area, but the dishwasher kept indicating that it needed a clean. So I can’t say I noticed much difference. The scent is very strong and overpowering and this would put me off using it again as I found it unpleasant.
Great value pack of dishwaser tablets, i use these a lot so buy every so often. I use dishwasher twice a daily in bsy family and these are great value tablets.
I found the product very easy to use but felt you would probably need 2 to do a thorough job.

The 2 bottles arrive in the usual cardboard box by Amazon. They are wrapped tightly together in a clear plastic cover which is easily removed by hand or with scissors etc.. To use, it really could not be easier. Just peel off a paper tab on the lid and place in the bottom of your empty dishwasher up side down. Lodge it between the spikes to keep it firmly in place. Put on a hot cycle 65 degrees at least (I do the Super Wash on the Bosch). Once the cycle is complete the bottle is empty and there really is a significant improvement on the inside of the dishwasher.. It does look cleaner and the limescale has been reduced although not completely as I have let it build up too long but a couple more of these over the next couple of months should clear it back completely. It is meant to be a monthly chore (no chore really as very easy). If you have any grease build up, it does remove it. My view is it does make your dishwasher perform better and look and smell better and to do this monthly or thereabouts is no real hardship.

This dishwasher cleaner has outperformed all others I have tried. It made my machine smell fantastically clean and the smell stayed for a few days. It is easy to put it in the plate holder section and it holds there firmly. I do not have a cutlery basket and I have struggled in the past to find somewhere to put the cleaner bottle. It stayed there all through the programme and cleaned the dishwasher well.. Highly recommended.

Bought during Covid so great fun for being able to get them. Work well on the dishes and glasses.. Amazon question for review ‘flavour’ ? I presume it’s computer generated. Really hope none actually can answer the question

This really does work extremely well for refreshing and cleaning out a dishwasher. We use them every 3 months in ours as we’ve seen large build ups of limescale on the walls of our dishwasher because of the London water. This stuff is pretty potent (as others have noted) but we just used the dishwasher as normal straight afterwards with no issues. If you want your dishwasher to last years then using these is a great idea.
Print on labels on the small side,instructions could be more clearer in a larger print.
Good value for money. Good price. Excellent product. Great service!

There seem to be so many conflicting reports on whether these are even necessary with modern day dishwasher tabs so I was a little skeptical at first.. Before I used this I lifted out the filter of our dishwasher which was surprisingly caked in a thin covering of slimey stuff. I guess this is just build up. I ran the dishwasher cleaner on the hottest, hardest cycle as it suggested. The first thing I noticed when I opened the dishwasher was the smell, it was lovely. All the bits were very cleaned and silver of the door was gleaming. I pulled out the filter again and the slimey stuff had gone. It had done what it said it would.. I give it 4 stars though as I question whether it is really necessary to do this every month, certainly at the cost of them. My initial concerns though were unfounded. For me, it did what it said it would.

Had a problem with a fault code appearing on my hotpoint. i read another review on here with the same code and the review said it worked so i gave it a go before an expensive trip to curry's.. I removed the tab, put it in the dishwasher and set it to the longest program. After just 10 mins the fault code came up, so i reset the washer and checked the cleaner product which had lots left in the bottle so i started the program again. This time it ran the whole 2 hour program with no faults!.. To make double sure i added the second bottle and ran a 1 hour 50 min program, and it got to the end with no faults!. I have since washed 9 dish loads and had no error code. before using the finish cleaner the dishwasher wouldn't work on any setting for longer than 10 mins or so.. It has worked for me, and if i get an error code again i will just buy more.

I have to say we usually buy our tablets from Costco, because they are cheaper and IMO do just as good a job. It was only because we were in lockdown that I bought these, to save myself a trip. They do the job just fine. In Greater London we still need to add Rinse Aid and Salt all the time - and I will go back to my costoc tablets as I feel they represent better value for money (especially as our dishwasher is on 2-3 times a day!) but for now happy with these.

By far these are the best dishwasher tablets I used. The dishes come out sparkling clean.. The price is great for the volume, this pack will last us for a few months and we’ll be back for more.. If you found this helpful, I would appreciate if you can press the helpful button :-)
Was sent 2 packs of 42 so even better value for money.
It’s ok but expensive were as lemon & baking soda / white vinegar would do more or less the same thing

These seem to have disappeared from our local supermarket and these are similarly priced. Arrived quickly and well packaged by Royal Mail. Good dishwasher cleaner. Original scent rather than the lemon ones I usually can find.. Your dishwasher needs to be able to reach either 60c/65c to be able to melt the seal. Use in an empty dishwasher. Take sticker off without damaging the seal underneath. Tip upside down and place in dish rack.
I have used these tablets in the past and always found them excellent. An ex cellent buy.

These cleaners make your dishwasher smell good and look sparkling inside, but I can't say whether they make my dishwasher work better... I mean how would you know? It takes the same amount of time and leaves the dishes looking the same after a wash, so I don't know whether this is one of those advertising things that makes you think you need something that you never knew you were missing!. I do have an issue with the dishwasher not working as it should at the moment, and it was suggested I try these to help shift any blockages in the pipes. What I can say is that they don't work for that purpose. Having said that it is nice to have it smelling fresh and looking clean.

My hotpoint dish washer can't perform as usual, keeping showing AL10 errod code and stop in the half, and left the detergent undissolved. Instead of calling the engineer or replace it, I decided to go the last try before turning her over. Ordered this product, and comes with 2x PACK. Tried first one, then do the dishes wash, still AL10 error, tried 2nd pack straight away, then do the dishes wash again, guess what, the AL10 code not showing anymore, thought just lucky, so tried 10 washes since and the error not showing again, and the dishes are sparkling as new. All in all, this product did it should do but may require do it regularly rather than when machine not working. Not 5 star due to I needed two instead of one cleaner to fix the problems.
Does exactly what it says on the pack

We bought a second hand dishwasher and when it came it was dirty, dull and smelled however just one of these popped in had the inside looking brand new and smelling clean and fresh we definitely recommend this product to anyone with a dishwasher

Doesn't really have a scent, although I would regard that as a positive since it cleans the dishwasher very well. It's also cheaper than my dishwasher manufacturers official cleaner and much easier to use. Remove the plastic tape off the top. Don't unscrew! Since there is a piece of wax that melts during the wash cycle releasing the cleaning fluid at the right moment. Place the bottle in the dishwasher plate holder on the bottom rack, with the blue cap downwards. Then set the hottest wash cycle for your dishwasher. This method works great and the second bottle is useful to repeat the process if it's not clean enough or to clean again at a later date.

If you live in the South East of England where the water is really hard then chances are that your dishwasher is suffering from limescale build up which is very difficult to remove. I decided to use this product as my glasses were coming out cloudy as well as my stainless steel cutlery which is not pleasant when you have guests. After using this product I could not believe the difference that it made. For many washes afterwards my dishes were coming out sparkling.

All Genuine Finish item, great price.Well worth the money.We have hard water here and a month old Bosch Dishwasher,so we are using this from the start.Our last Bosch lasted 15 years of every day use without any problems until it finally became uneconomical to repair.
Very good for cleaning your machine

Our dishwasher is fairly clean most of the time but it does need a freshening up from time to time and that is where this item comes in. It descales and degreases and if you want to open one you can use the solution to clean the door seal' personally i use a little bleach on kitchen roll to achieve the same result, but always ensure that I wipe it several times afterwards with a moist cloth to remove the excess as I fear it will over time damage the seal.. So how does this Finish product perform? As far as I can tell it does a good job. You remove the cap, peel off a sticker and place the bottle spout side down in the lower cage. Set the machine temperature for 65 degrees plus (I used the intensive symbol for pans on my Bosch machine) set off the programme and a couple of hours later, after the cycle had finished removed the empty bottle. It did seem very clean inside my machine and the spray arms seemed free of any debris. Perhaps the main thing was it had that undertone, similar to rotten eggs which came through despite the perfume of the product to suggest that it had been descaling the machine. So it does seem to do exactly what it states.. So why 4 stars and not 5? Price, pure and simple. It isn't that cheap and there are cheaper products available which do the same job at a third of the price; these may not be quite as good, but if you are cleaning your machine every month as what this and the cheaper product suggest, I feel that I would trial the cheaper product to see if that worked. It did for me and therefore after I have used the second of this pack, I will be back to my Sainsbury dishwasher cleaner.
Gets your dishwasher beautifully clean and smelling like new.
Nice product, it works. Cheapest I found, but never can understand why this stuff is so expensive!

This cleaner consists of a neat, narrow bottle that sits upside down in your plate rack. You put the machine on a wash (over 65º) and it cleans the machine. As far as I can tell, it does the job well - the machine certainly does smell fresh afterwards.. This product does, in fact, offer two functions. One (and the crucial one) is as a descaler to eliminate limescale (probably using citric or sulfamic acid). The second function is as a degreaser (basically a detergent) - something you could imitate by running the dishwasher empty but with a dishwasher tablet in on a hot wash (does this degrease better? Perhaps, but I really can't tell). (By the way, for general descaling purposes on kettles and coffee makers I'd recommend citric acid, the basis of many proprietary products, which you can buy very cheaply in bulk).. The phrases 'as far as I can tell' and 'perhaps...' above indicates what makes this review difficult. Certainly if you live in a hard-water area like London, limescale will build up quickly and this does waste energy and will eventually bring many machines to a halt. So descaling is a very good idea, but how can you tell how often you should descale and whether it has worked? That is the problem.. All in all, this is a good product. How often you need to use is and whether is works better or worse than alternatives is difficult to evaluate, but I don't think you'd go wrong by using this product once a month so, on that basis, I'd recommend it.

I first bought this dishwasher cleaner about 6 months ago. I had scum foaming around the edges and it was starting to smell bed. I was a little sceptical about this product, but now my dishwasher looks like it did when I bought it! I probably clean my dishwasher every month so i signed up to subscribe and save. You get two packs with every purchase, so you save a ton and it's really convenient!
It is just what it says it is?

When you get a dishwasher, it's recommended that, along with salt and rinse aid, that occasionally you should put a cleaner in it too. You slot this block in an empty dishwasher, peel back the sticker, making sure you don't put anything else in the dishwasher, before running it on a full cycle. The cleaner cleans everything in the dishwasher - the pipes, shelves, anything that can be cleaned will be cleaned, and it does a fantastic job of it. We were chuffed with how shiny everything was afterwards and how much residue was removed. The dishwasher smelt better too. (I know, weird thing to say.) Don't forget you also get two of these! So it's a bargain, and you'll have a clean dishwasher to show for it.
Cant fault it. Use all the time. Average price dishwasher always clean after. Recommended

It is very difficult to reliably review something like this because I cannot tell if it did anything without dismantling my dishwasher.. However, I did have trouble with the auto program on the dishwasher not working recently. I tried after doing a clean with this and auto worked fine.. Unlike other cleaners in the past, which fitted in the cutlery tray, this monster fits in the plate rack. Peel off the paper tab, invert and place in a plate slot, set a hot program (I used intensive) and start. Make sure otherwise that the dishwasher is empty.. The dishwasher certainly smells different now, and that has persisted after another wash cycle. So, did it remove any blockages? Who knows?. Edit: Several days later. Something has changed! There must have been a blockage somewhere as the dishwasher is working far better and cleaning better. Also drying has improved. The performance of this high-end Bosch washer had decreased gradually but now it is back to as-new. I am also using the Finish rinse aid and have turned the dispenser setting down from 5 before to 1 now.. So, on the basis of this evidence, I can recommend both.

I have tried all sorts of different products to try and keep our dishwasher running at its best - from powders to cleaners and fresheners and even vinegar. This is the best I have tried (although the vinegar works surprisingly well! It gets rid of any stale smells and leaves the entire inside that I can see clean and sparkly and I can only believe that it cleans further than I can see (but I haven't made deep investigations into the "hidden parts" that it alleges to clean, but having used this over the last few years, it does the trick. I don't feel the need to use it as often as it recommends, but about every 3 or 4 months seems to work well for our family of 4 - so a dual pack lasts for 6-8 months for us and for a lower useage, I would think you could use it less frequently, say every six months - but I am sure that Finish would say more frequently!

I suppose that it's easy to think that because the dishwasher does a great job of cleaning the dishes and pots and pans that it somehow keeps itself clean. So when I saw this product I thought "well, perhaps it doesn't and I should give this a go".. And I'm impressed. Easy to use, just take the tear off strip off the cap, pop it in the empty dishwasher with cap facing down, put it on a decent temperature programme and start the dishwasher.. A cycle later and the dishwasher looked and smelled cleaner. It didn't smell unpleasant before the wash, but this product gives it a fresh, just cleaned aroma. And the inside sparkled. Not sure that I will want to use it once a month, but certainly will use it regularly from now on.

Allegedly, it's a good idea to periodically clean your dishwasher. I suspect there may be an element of creating artificial demand for a product that in some way differs from the dishwasher tablets that you could just as easily run through a cycle in an empty dishwasher to clean it out, but I thought we'd give it a try.. This was very easy to use; basically open it, put the bottle upside down in the lower drawer and run the dishwasher, but it does advise that you set the temperature over 65°C, which is a bit tricky for us as our dishwasher doesn't go up that high. Nonetheless, it did the job and scoured all the nooks and crannies of the dishwasher with no effort from me.. Win.

You'd think that a device that cleans itself every time you use it wouldn't need any extra cleaning, right? Well, apparently that's not the case as washing dishes might leave the visible parts of your dishwasher sparkling but the chemicals used don't do much for its valuable internals, the bits that matter. The residue from foods can cling to a dishwasher's insides, adding to the problems, while limescale build-up (if not treated) can apparently be as damaging.. Using the cleaner is simply a matter of peeling off the label on top of the bottle cap, placing the bottle upside-down in the dishwasher, then running a standard wash programme with a temperature of at least 65 degrees. The heat from the water unseals the retaining bung inside the cap, allowing the liquid out to do its stuff. Giving your dishwasher a clean on a hot cycle is a good idea anyway, and this goes for washing machines as well, but what Finish won't do is to get rid of any muck that builds up in the trap, so regular cleaning-out is still a must.. I've been using Finish's dual-action dishwasher cleaner on-and-off for a few years and it appears to be working well; I say 'appears' because after a wash my dishwasher always looks clean, or at least the bits I can see do. I'm assuming that the stuff is cleaning and protecting the internals but without taking my dishwasher apart I guess I'll never really know.

Disaster struck last week. Our dishwasher flooded (anti flood my eye!) After an excruciating 4 days with no dishwasher (I will never complain about stacking again) the repair man came out. He repaired the dishwasher (piece of plastic lid in pump) and declared it...and I quote.... "unfeasibly clean". He asked us what our secret was.....and it's this! I must confess to using one every 3-4 months - certainly not monthly, as required - but it must be doing the trick. We live in a very hard water area so I was amazed to be told there was "virtually no build up whatsoever". Thoroughly recommended.
Good offer. Cheaper than the supermarkets. Came as expected. All Good!!

I use a cleaner in my dishwasher around every 6 months, & I've used various brands. I found this one much the same as any other I've used it does exactly what's expected - you tear off the sticker on the lid & place the full bottle in the plate rack & run the empty machine on a normal program over 65degrees. It leaves the machine smelling really fresh & clean & gleeming inside.. Also before I put it in the machine I like to put a little bit on a cloth & use it to clean the seals & around the inside edges of the door. definitely worth buying to give your machine a good clean

I have tried various other brands of dishwasher cleaner (stores own brand etc) but nothing gets the dishwasher as squeaky clean as this Finish product.. So easy to use, just peel of the sticker from the top of the bottle (DO NOT UNSCREW TOP), place upside down in the plate rack of the dishwasher, set it for a wash cycle (anything above 65 degrees) and start the cycle.. When finished, you are left with a spotless dishwasher and an empty bottle of cleaner.. This is set at a good price point on Amazon too. Much cheaper than my regular supermarket. Considerable savings to be made here, especially if used as per manufacturer instructions of once a month.. Recommended.

I always use this cleaner in my dishwasher. Every few months my dishwasher starts to smell a bit, and I notice that the dishes and cutlery are not coming out really sparkling.. You just take the lid off the plastic bottle and turn it upside down and put it in the bottom of the dishwasher. You run a normal cycle. When you open your dishwasher it will smell lovely and the interior will be sparkling. The next time you run a cycle your dishes will be really clean too.

Having had my lovely AEG dishwasher for about 7 years now I must confess I have never really thought about using a specific cleaner. I have run it on empty - parhaps once a year and emptied out the filter bit but beyond this I hadn't really done much.. Had seen these in the supermarket before but never purchased as wasn't really sure whether it was necessary..... So this claims to beak down any grease build up and make sure your machine stays in tip top shape. The advice is to use one per month but I'm thinking maybe this is excessive- I'd have to get the feedback from a dishwasher engineer to figure out whether this is really useful advice or a marketing stragtegy!. Anyway, pack come with 2 packs, its extremely simple to use - just peel off the sticky top, turn the pod upside down and place in your dishwasher. Run on a high temp setting.. I have to say as I was intrigued I opened the door mid cycle to have a peek - and it was lovely and all lathery inside, and the smell was very good.. Afterwards the machine did look shinier and smell much fresher so I think something good happened!. The next load of dishes pretty much looked the same, so not sure it had any direct effect on that!. I liked this and will buy it again, but probably every few months rather than every month....

These have been recommended by me by my dishwasher repair man in the past and I finally got to try one. Very simple to use, just empty your dishwasher, peel the sticker off the top of the bottle lid and place upside down on the bottom rack (where the plates normally slot) and put the dishwasher on the hottest setting. I was impressed as it really cleared away the grime and grease and buildup of limescale at the edges where the door shuts. It says to use these once a month to keep your dishwasher working well, but that's up to you. Try it.
The best product of its kind on the market

Excellent value for the money. Found it to be dearer elsewhere. Keeps my dishwasher up and running. All items come out sparkling/ free from food. Reduces the build up of limescale.There are other products on the market but I always use "Finish "Also recommended by dishwasher manufacturers.

Tried this today and the dishwasher is already a far fresher place! It is easy to forget that the detritus has to go somewhere when you use your dishweasher regularly for greasy plates, dishes, pans etc. This product is great and so easy to use - just rip off the paper tab, pop it into the bottom tray and run a programme (empty) at the prescribed heat et voila! The dishwasher smells fresher and is cleaner. Well worth the once a month recommended use of this product.

This is a must have item for your dishwasher,just take the cap off take the cover of the top turn it upside down and place in the cutlery basket,set the machine of on a hot wash,not only does it make the dishwasher smell fresh it cleans all the film from the interior of the machine+any odds and ends that do collect after use over a period of time,good price from Amazon worth having,go on treat the dishwasher to a Christmas present and see your machine shine.

I swear by Finish dishwasher cleaner. I've used cheaper supermarket own-brand cleaners in the past, but nothing works quite as well as Finish, in my opinion. Really simple to use - peel off the sticker on the lid, place it upside-down (so the nozzle facing down) it in the bottom rack of your empty dishwasher (just as you would a plate), and run a minimum 65 degree cycle. Finish recommends using it monthly, but I probably use one every 2-3 months when I remember!

Really great product. Have tried this before when I felt my dishwasher wasn't cleaning the dishes as well as it used to. Once a cycle of this had gone through the dishes were coming up a lot better. You do have to use the whole bottle at once but it's completely worth it. I tend to use this around every 6 weeks now and recommend to anyone having issues with their dishwasher.

Thats probably the only time I'll use any kind of dishwasher cleaner; when I haven't cleaned the filters in a while, other than that my dishwasher is cared for well enough in that I never put in anything with food stuck on etc so I really didn't really see any difference in the shine and smell after I used this.. So again Its only really necessary to use this kind of cleaner if you haven't cleaned your filters in a long while.

Hard water area? When we got a problem with a blocked Dishwasher it was a nightmare - not because we had to wash up, but because it was so difficult to work out how to unblock it. A little float in dishwashers tells the machine it is filling OK or over filled - this gets stuck due to limescale and the machine refuses to work - all seems a minor problem, but many people can't find the float and can't mend it - so. many machines are thrown away in all but working order.. Once cleaned and working I started using these Finish cleaners to proactively ensure this never happened again - and it hasn't - using these once a month on a hot cycle in an empty machine. I would rate higher, but think they are quite expensive and only just have the power to do their job. Would recommend everyone using them though.

I only really use dishwasher cleaners from time to time and I certainly don't do it once a month as advised. In fact my new dishwasher has just reached 1 year old and has never had dishwasher cleaner put through it. So I thought it was about time to do so, not because there was a problem, but only because I am told that I should do it.. The truth of the matter is I keep forgetting to use a dishwasher cleaner. It always looks sparkling clean on the inside and the filters are removed and cleaned regularly. The dishes always come out clean and the machine is odour free. I am very skeptical when you see the adverts of dull grey machines with heavily gunge clogged pipes suddenly become bright and shiny with clear pipe work. If the dishwasher cleans grease from the plates, why should it build up in the very pipework that carries the same grease busting cleaning fluids? Then to give you the final frightener you have the "You wouldn't wash your dishes in dirty water" voice-over warning. Well, actually you do, the soapy water is washing over your dirty dishes, cycling around and getting sprayed back onto them - repeatedly, no different to washing several dishes in a bowl of water. The rinsing is what finalizes the clean. So you have to forgive me if I just don't buy into this and question if the whole dishwasher cleaner is a bit of hype to get you to buy something you don't really need or at least don't need to do as often.. That being said, I duly run the cleaner through my machine and let the cycle run. Afterwards my machine looked and smelt no different than it did before I used it. Likewise, my dishes are no different post-cleaner as they were pre-cleaner. My last dishwasher had the occasional cleaner put through it and that lasted 4 years before I replaced it for a larger one. The old one is still working now and is just as effective.. I guess if you live in an area that suffers lime scale it might be something you want to use regularly, otherwise just use an intense 70 degree wash from time to time, that should be enough to clean anything out. I am not saying never use dishwasher cleaner, but ask yourself if you think you need to do it every month as they suggest.. I can't say that this is a bad product, but I can't say that it is going to make a difference to your dishwasher either and the same applies to any dishwasher cleaner.

While dishwashers get the dishes and cutlery clean they themselves build up residues of grease and limescale in the process so I always clean my machine once a month and this product is amazing effective - it really does leave the machine sparkling and sweet-smelling and there's certainly no obvious limescale deposit, a real hazard when you live in London. Well worth the money.

Very simple product which works exactly as it says it will. Peel off little sticker, pop in bottom rack of otherwise empty dishwasher and set it on off a high-temperature wash (min 65 degrees C).. The dishwasher is left sparkling clean and fresh inside. Not sure if other brands might do the same more cheaply, but I can't fault this product and would happily buy it again.

I tend to be someone who prefers natural products, but sometimes chemically-based ones are necessary as they are the only things that work and this works!. The moment the dishwasher starts to leave a greasy residue on my dishes, I pop one of these in and they work beautifully: disintegrating grease, unblocking the drains and cleaning the dishwasher itself so that everything comes out clean again.

I would recommend this dishwasher cleaner to anyone.The inside of the dishwasher smells beautiful and looks sparkling and clean I would definately use this product again.I normally use Finish all in one tabs in my dishwasher anyway, but I have never used Finish cleaner, I usually go for a cheaper version, but I will be sticking to this one now as it makes such a difference.

The instructions on the bottle were easy to follow and the product made an excellent job of cleaning my well-used dishwasher. In addition to the end result of a very clean dishwasher it also left a fresh smelling machine. I have not used this or anything similar previously but I shall certainly use the product egularly in future.
Leaves the dishwasher clean inside as food and scum build up over time

I've used Finish dishwasher cleaner for some years and it really delivers. There is always some build up on the surfaces inside a dishwasher particularly if you wash a lot of greasy dishes. Finish cuts through that and leaves your dishwasher sparkling clean and fresh smelling.. A very easy recommendation.
Leaves your dish washer as good as new

A job I could never remember to do, clean the dishwasher. This product is so simple and easy I finally did it.. You simply peel off the sticker from the bottle top. Turn it upside down and place in the lower half of the washer in the plate rack.. Put the dishwasher on a program that runs at 65 degrees or higher.. And that's it job done.. The package says to repeat every other month, and as it is so easy I might even do that.. Results ? Well I thought my dishwasher worked well anyway and using this product has improved the cleaning to a higher standard and also makes me feel I am taking care of an expensive and useful machine.

I'm one of those people who have used dishwashers for years and rather tend to take them for granted. As such a good cleaner "run" once in a while is well worth the almost complete lack of effort. Pull off the tab, put it in the dishwasher on a fairly high setting (65C suggested) and it's done. I've used Finish a few times in the past and the results are very good. The dishwasher looks genuinely clean and smells fresh too. I confess I tend to buy Finish when they are on offer and cheaper brands otherwise but that is really my only reservation. Good product which works well.

I must admit, I have used Finish product for several years. I did a bit of experermenting with different brands but always came back to Finish as its the best out there.. My Mum always used to say it was pointless buying a dishwasher cleaner as it was already being cleaned by the detergent but this stuff gets rid of all the grease build up of food particles and general muck.. I wouldn't be without it

Nice chemical dishwasher cleanser. Gets rid of any grease, etc. you might have in there. I certainly noticed a better clean for the next few uses following a clean.. The label recommends doing it monthly, I'd perhaps suggest every 2/3 months.. Smells fairly putrid and chemically but will definitely clear out any lingering smells you have in there, and doesn't last too long.. Works well on a quick wash (as long as it reaches 65 degrees). Good product.

Leaves dishwasher sparkling clean with a pleasant scent. Much better than supermarket own brands I have used in past. Be aware needs minimum temp of 65 degrees to work according to instructions, I know not all dishwashers go this high.

I have tried many, many dishwasher cleaners over the decades but always return to this one. I find it much superior to the supermarket own brand or the powder sachet cleaners. This one cuts through all the grease and you can pour some onto a cloth or sponge so you can give the metals door surrounds and hinges a great clean too (which you can't do with the powders. The only downside is that it does smell strongly of chemicals - so after use I do an extra empty wash to make sure it has all been washed away before refilling my dishwasher.

The amount of build-up of grease inside my dishwasher, together with the linked unpleasant small, has bothered me. This product, though admittedly more expensive than some, does the job and is extremely welcome. I have no hesitation in recommending it.

Let's face it, it's easy to neglect cleaning your dishwasher, so this product is just what you need to solve that problem. It's very simple to use, makes a difference to the cleanliness and even makes it smell nicer. What's not to like? Just buy it.
Essential product for dishwashers. Cheaper than the supermarket.
This stuff works well and leaves the dishwasher shiny and smelling good. We use it a few times a year and always keep one in stock in the cupboard. Recommended.
Run one of these through every 6 months, and it's done a fine job of getting rid of some of the muck that gathers in their nether regions. The dishwasher is sparkling clean and smells nice. Top Job.

i have been using these every month for over 6 months now....and they never fail to disappoint!. simply pop on bottle into your dishwasher rack - ( i use the hottest cycle ) and press go!!. an hour later your dishwasher is sparkling clean and smells clean and fresh!!!. simples!!!!

With our dishwasher less than a year old, I was supprised at how greasy and dull it had started to look. Using this cleaner made it look like new again. Wonderful. Easy to use and easy to spot the difference afterwards.

This is a great product. Dishwashers, whilst doing a fantastic job, do suffer from being a bit smelly, greasy and sticky from the debris left after the dishwashing has taken place.. Easy to use, following the simple instructions, our dishwasher came out of the cycle smelling a whole lot fresher, the grease in the trap, despite having been rinsed and soaped previously, was squeaky clean again. The interior of the dishwasher, even around the seal, was squeaky clean.. Makes you have more confidence in your dishwasher, when you have a back up product like the Finish dishwasher cleaner to rely on.
This is dead simple to use and it does it's job.. You stick it in upside down and put the machine on.. After one cycle it worked - neat and simple
Having used other dishwasher cleaners, I always come back to Finish. This is a very effective cleaner with a nice fragrance too. Recommended.

This useful cleaner pack slots into the bottom rack of your (otherwise empty) dishwasher, you run a cycle and it gives the dishwasher a thorough clean in the process.. Our dishwasher was noticeably more sparkling and clean afterwards.

Washing the Dish Washer seems like an odd concept. Surely the thing is always being washed? This is not the case as anyone who has eaten enough garlic and olive oil will attest. Some of foods eventually start to stick to the inside of the washer, in particular a thin sheen of grease and stronger smells. At this point it is time to buy some cleaner for your washer!. I have used several different products to do this that range in price. `Finish Dishwasher Cleaner' is not always the cheapest, but it does one of the best jobs. It is really easy to use, just peel off the sticker on the top and stack it in the dish rack upside down with the dishwasher empty. Now run a cycle. Once the cleaning cycle has finished you will instantly see the difference; it will smell a lot nicer and the chrome insides should have a shine to them usually only seen in adverts on TV. I use one of these every few months and it makes the dishwasher and my kitchen smell much less musty.

I have no doubt that it is sensible to use a dishwasher cleaner from time to time. Our dishwasher is 12 years old and to my knowledge has never had any cleaner through it apart from the dishwasher tabs that are used for the wash cycle plus the salt to soften the water and the finish to put the sparkle back on the glasses etc. So, I believe using the cleaner once a month perhaps benifits the manufacturer for more than the actual machine. I am going to get some cleaner today to give my dishwasher an extra clean after all these years just to see if there is a difference.

It's been a long time since I saw an item on the Amazon Vine programme I actually needed in my life, so when I saw these I was actually over the moon - perhaps that has a part to play in why I'm so disappointed; that and the fact they didn't work... at all.. A few months ago my Smeg dishwasher stopped working - life's been a major headache ever since as being a 30 something bachelor who works long hours I relied heavily on it. My house has basically descended into chaos and I'm ashamed to say is a bit if a tip.. The machine is telling me the pump is broken or blocked as it's not draining properly and I read up on how to unblock it myself - which I kind of did with a mixture of white vinegar and baking soda; however it's never quite been the same.. I hoped these would be it's saving grace yet I put one, in ran the machine through a cycle and literally nothing happened. And I mean nothing!. On opening the machine, the liquid was still in the bottle and the plastic plug in the cap (which I guess was meant to melt or was meant to be pulled off when you remove a sticker before you put it upside down your tray) was still intact.. For me this was a total waste if time and I think the main problem is the stupid delivery system. Sorry, but I can't recommend these at all. Maybe I got a bad batch, but that was my experience.

Popped one of these into my dishwasher and was pleasantly surprised! My dishwasher is fairly new anyway so wasn't really expecting a difference but there was a clear change in the inside of my washer. I don't know what happened but it was like someone had 'waxed' the metalwork inside the machine. What had appeared to be dull and 'normal' was all nice and shiny. I'm not sure if this carried all the way through to de-scaling the limescale or similar but certainly from what I could see it did a great job. The smell was quite good as well. Not that my machine smelt bad ... just it now smelled better. So would I recommend it? YES!
These are excellent for giving your dishwasher a good spring clean. Just pop in every month or so to have confidence that any build up of chemicals or grease is swept away. I remain very impressed.

Much like some of the other reviewers here, I'm a little unsure how to judge this: it's certainly easy to use; you just peel a sticker off the cap and load the bottle upside down in the lower compartment as if it were a plate, then run the thing on a full, hot cycle (it advises 65 degrees, which is a little beyond my machine). The end result was indeed a clean dishwasher, although I can't honestly say that mine normally looks particularly dirty... maybe a little duller, more lacklustre... possibly. Not that I particularly care whether or not the thing is lustrous on the inside. Most tablets including those made by Finish already contain a salt/rinse aid/machine limescale protection function... which makes me question whether there really is an exigency to use this stuff, especially on a monthly basis. On balance then, I'm not a covert, but if you definitely want to use a dishwasher cleaner, then I can't think of an easier, cleaner one than this.

You might think that a dishwasher will clean itself - after all, every time it's used, it gets full of hot soapy water - but anybody who's had a dishwasher for a while will know that isn't the case. If your dishwasher is like ours, after a few months it will look greasy inside, look pretty yucky at the bottom, and will start to smell slightly unpleasant.. The Finish Dishwasher cleaner sorts this out. Simply wedge it in rack in the dishwasher, remove the lid, set a full cycle off (without any actual dishes in the dishwasher), and once the cycle finishes, the dishwasher a) smells lovely, and b) looks sparkly enough to eat one's lunch off. Does exactly what one would expect, and have been very pleased with the results.

I live in a very hard water area so thought this would be a good product to try. I regularly clean the inside of my dishwasher including the filters, so was really using it to clean the hidden parts, filters, spray arms and pipes as it claims on the package. Not really sure how you can tell if it has done this or not since they are hidden! So unless you took the dishwasher apart, you can't tell. I haven't noticed any difference in how clean my dishes are either.. I wouldn't use this product once a month as it recommends on the label, since I can't really see what visible difference it makes. This is the first time I have used a cleaner of this sort in 3.5 years so don't think it would be worth it, other than to give you peace of mind that you may be prolonging the life of your dishwasher.

Given that this is supposed to be used at 65c, I had wondered how effective it would be at 55c, which is the maximum for my dishwasher. The answer? It is fine. The dishwasher is now sparkling and smells nice too. Given that it hasn't had a 'treatment' for a few months, the lower temp doesn't seem to matter at all. Not bad value at the amazon price for the 2 bottle pack.

The finish dual action dishwasher cleaner is a bit of strange one to test. You are supposed to use this once a month; so I did a run through with my finish power ball tablets; emptied my dishwasher and then immediately I ran it through my dishwasher with the cleaner.. After that first run through there was a feeling of this being the emperors new clothes - visually I couldn't see any difference.. As a single frequent traveller my dishwasher is used maybe once a fortnight and is only a year old. As part of the extensive list of benefits the stand out one for me is Finish say the dishwasher cleaner it removes limescale; I have had two dishwashers fail in the past 10 years through limescale build up.. Its not especially expensive; a couple of pounds a month and if it does make my dishwasher last longer its likely a price worth paying.

I'm more and more convinced that it's the name you buy with these products. I've noticed no difference in the dishwasher and the bottle shows the same contents as my usual supermarket dishwasher cleaner. As you have to use it every month the price difference becomes quite a lot.. The bottle is easy to use, just peel back the label, put it in the machine `upside down' and set your dishwasher going on the hottest setting.. There will be a nice clean sparkle from your machine, but I think that once I've trialled these I'll be back to my usual supermarket cleaner and only buy Finish Dishwasher Cleaner when it's on special offer.

We often use dishwasher cleaners, it's never something I've believed we actually need to do.. Like all others, these are easy to use... peel off the label on the top and place upside down in the dishwasher. Switch it on (at least 65 degrees). Don't put anything else in there. Once completed, throw out the bottle, done.. Using these have given no benefit, the dishwasher is clean anyway, the plates were clean anyway, and the dishwasher smells the same as it always has done.

Being like most people, it's rare that I think to clean anything that actually cleans other things but I thought I would give this a try as my dishwasher is just over a couple of years old now. I live in a soft water area and don't have limescale concerns but bearing in mind all the stuff that dishwashers deal with I thought I would give this a try. It's simple to use, peel off the sticky label on the top and upend it into a plate slot set the temperature and turn it on - easy! However, when the cycle finished all I could smell was a kind of chemical steam. The smell went off, of course, but the next cycle of dishes still had one or two things that had to be run through again so no advantage was gained from this "Finish" as far as dishwasher performance is concerned. I tend to remove most fat and scraps of food before I load things into the dishwasher and do run it through empty on a very high heat sometimes so that's what I shall continue to do - and save the money this stuff costs.
having bought the product I tried it and it did not seem to work. I am trying it again. The instructions seem clear but now just hoping!

OK I admit it, until I saw this product I hadn't realised I was supposed to clean my dishwasher other than a quick wipe with a soapy cloth occasionally. For about 3 years it has cleaned dishes perfectly and the shiny bits inside are all shiny and there is no limescale visible (we live in a hard water area as evidenced by the disgusting state the kettle element gets into regularly). However the outlet pipe in the bottom does look pretty gunky, so when I saw this product I thought I'd give it a go.. It is easy to use; you just peel the little label from the top, invert the container and put it in a plate slot at the bottom of an empty dishwasher. You run the empty dishwasher through its hottest longest cycle. That done I opened the door to find that the walls, spray arm etc all looked exactly as they did before and the gunky outlet looked slightly less gunky. There was a nice smell, which disperses very quickly.. Can't say I would use this product again, but it may work for other scenarios. It may be that my current dishwash products (a leading supermarket's Basics dishwash tablets, and the cheapest salt and rinse aid I can find) are already doing the job.

Unlike the other reviewers here, I am having trouble buying into the value of this product. We do, on occasion, run the dishwasher without anything in it, to clean it through. The addition of this product doesn't seem to make any noticeable difference. Without the benefit of doing a forensic investigation, I don't know if the dishwasher is cleaner having used this product, but I suspect not. Was it clean, sparkling and clean smelling? Well, yes, yes and kind of. The machine is always clean after a wash because water and cleaning products don't discriminate against the machine itself, and the smell wasn't as nice as a Finish cleaning tablet.. I can't advise readers to buy this product as a must-have. Try running your dishwasher with nothing but your usual dishwashing products - that might be enough.

These are damaging to my pans!! And to add insult to injury They left COOKED ON RESIDUE FROM AN OVEN RECIPE TOO!!!!. ! Pans that have been dishwasher cleaned painlessly for years have been permanently damaged when I use these for first time this week!!! The outer finish on the base of my 'Neverstick' pans has been stripped of its finish by those things!! I'm furious!!!!! (Can you tell?) I've been using the "Astonish" tabs for ages but these came up on offer so I bought-theyre going in bin!! A total Aste of money , I have complained so interesting to see what response I get.i bought last September but only just opened new pack. Livid!! My lovely pans!!!
i was recommended this and wasn’t disappointed.

A very easy to use cleaner, and does a good job at leaving the inside of my Bosch dishwasher shiny with a 'neutral' smell - Finish also do a lemon scented cleaner but personally I prefer the non-scented as I don't want it to mask anything that's still there.. It's particular good at clearing out the spray arm holes.. Usually use this cleaner every 3 months or so as I use my dishwasher daily, coupled with cleaning the filters in the appliance as this cleaner won't clean those as fully as a hand wash.

I am very impressed by this. My dishwasher has some tough stains from some cans I cleaned and this cleaned it right up after one wash. Now adding to subscribe and save because it worked that well. Would definitely recommend.

Excellent cleaner for the dish washer. I have been using this brand and the product for sometime now and it keeps my dishwasher clean, as new as it gets. It is a value for money product and very easy to use, just remove the cap and place it upside down in the dishwasher and it takes care of everything.. The scent is light and is not necessarily quite evident, so i would say don't buy it if you are looking for fragrance. Otherwise it does the magic and relatively cheap.

My dishwasher, although I use products that are supposedly meant to keep it fresh, was starting to smell so I bought these. Very easy instructions and excellent outcome. My dishwasher, although it now has no scent at all, is much cleaner. This got rid of A LOT of limescale stains (our area has very hard/rough water). I would definitely recommend this.

I can't speak for other tablets but we have not had our new dishwasher long and these were recommended by work colleague. They are brilliant. Leaves glasses smear free and great for removing grease and grime. Great price as well on Amazon, cheaper than anyhwere else i have tried.

Ive tried most of the tablets and Finish are, in my opinion, still the best.. Good value bag when on offer and I do think you get what you pay for. Some supermarkets are catching up with their wrapper free premium tablets but these are still a cut above.. Great results on everything, very versatile and effective.

Standard dishwasher product at a great price. These dishwasher tablets happen work particularly well on all programs in our Bosch dishwasher compared to the competition. Delivery was well packaged and quick from the supplier.

Love that these tablets come in a cardboard box. I have an older dishwasher (15+yrs) and it can’t cope with the ‘dissolving’ wrapper tablets. These are ideal for my machine. Pots are clean. I always use Finish, these tabs are what I always use. My Samsung dishwasher is two months old, however the tabs are just not cleaning properly. The settings on the machine are right, so what is the problem? I am reliably informed that if dishwasher tablets are stored incorrectly they will not work. Now I cannot comment to be fair on how these were stored, but they are not producing the right result. Diese Tabs haben eine neuartige Machart mit weicher, wasserlöslicher Umhüllung, bekannt erstmals von Wachmaschinen-Tabs. Dies löst mein Problem, dass bei vorherigen Käufen, feste Tabs durch den Transport teilweise oder ganz zerbröselt sind und sich nicht mehr über einen eigentlichen vorgesehen Spül-Zeitraum langsam auflösen können.. Ich habe vier Stück von Amazon als kostenlose Probepackung erhalten, ich kaufe bislang die vorherigen Finish-Produkte. Mit diesen nicht ganz billigen Produkten bin ich bislang bestens zufrieden, die Waschkraft ist hervorragend, solang man die eigene Spülmaschine hinsichtlich Verschmutzungsgrad, Waschprogramm und Beladung richtig nutzt. Diese Tabs sind nicht schlechter.. Etwas verbessert hat sich die Glanzleistung; mein Geschirr wirkt polierter. Dies scheint auch die Trocknerleistung der Spülmaschine positiv zu beeinflussen. Gerade dieser Punkt ist mir seit einem Wechsel auf einen A+-Wärmepumpenspüler besonders wichtig; diese Geräte trocken mit weniger Energie länger und leider schlechter als die alten Energiefresser.

Have been buying these for a few months having moved from the Fairy brand and I must say i am pleased with their performance. My dishwasher doesn't constantly need salt and it cleans very well and the dishes come out smelling nice and clean. Bought cheap dish washer tablets before, and they don’t clean as well as these do, amazing how they get rid of even baked on stuff. Very happy with them, and great price and delivery on Amazon.

These tablets are great at cleaning – even ‘scrambled eggs pans’! With other tablets, it is sometimes necessary to hand scrub items when small bits of well-cooked/burnt-on food get left behind – this was not the case when using Finish Quantum Infinity Shine Dishwasher Tablets all my dishes came out perfectly spotless. The scent is noticably stronger than 'Normal' Finish as well. In fact, I often use Finish Ultimate Lemon and, to my nose at least (and I'm often told its quite an impressive nose. Well. Large, anyway) these pods actually smelled more lemony than the lemon ones. Im not 100% sure that it's lemon I can smell, but it's definitely citrussy - quite strong but clean smelling.. These tablets are good at cleaning everyday-use glassware as well – all glassware that I use regularly washed really well with no streaking. Some other reviewers have mentioned that the tablets are not as good on ‘soft glass’ – I’ve not had experience of this, but you might just need to be careful if you are washing ‘special’ glassware. My trusty Duraflex cups can pretty much take anything (we used to use them in my Primary school, and if they can take that, they can take anything) and they came out looking lovely.. One thing I did notice though was that although the tablets were not sticking together in the pack when I first opened it, I did find that they were beginning to become a little sticky after about 5 or six days, even though I sealed the pack after getting each tablet out. I’ve since put the tablets in an air-tight plastic container, so you’d need to be careful with storing unused tablets. Some of the tablets were burst on delivery as well - not many (I'd have said two, possibly three) but it's definitely a drawback of supplying the product in a plastic bag, no matter how tough the bag is. Competitors send theirs boxed (which Finish used to also do in days gone by) and I never had burst capsules in those days (mind you, I also had hair in those days so perhaps we can't all have what we want!).. Overall, the tablets are good - probably the best I have tried in all honesty - at cleaning and I’m very happy with them.
